Debug:

  typed sources (boot/db/pwa/import/engine/global) and severities
  (info/success/warn/error). Global error + unhandledrejection listeners
  installed at module load. generateReport() for clipboard export.
- Add DebugPill.vue — floating pill showing entry count + error/warn

  Environment tab (URL, UA, screen, online, SW support, etc.).

commits.subject: feat(mvp): implement full MVP — phases 1-7
commits.body:
Complete implementation of all 7 phases of the budgy-ting product definition:

Phase 1 — Budget Management:
  - BudgetForm (create/edit), BudgetCreateView, BudgetEditView
  - Cascade delete (expenses + actuals), ConfirmDialog component

Phase 2 — Expense Management:
  - ExpenseForm with category autocomplete from IndexedDB
  - ExpensesTab grouped by category, edit/delete per item
  - useCategoryAutocomplete composable

Phase 3 — Projection Engine:
  - Pure TypeScript engine handling all 6 frequency types
  - Partial month and boundary clamping logic
  - ProjectedTab with by-item/by-category toggle

Phase 4 — Import Wizard:
  - CSV parser (RFC 4180), JSON parser, column auto-detection
  - 3-pass matching engine (exact, fuzzy, amount-only)
  - 4-step wizard: upload, map, review/approve, confirm

Phase 5 — Comparison Views:
  - Variance calculation engine
  - Line item, category, monthly views with CSS bar charts
  - Overspend/underspend colour coding with 5% tolerance

Phase 6 — Export/Import:
  - JSON export with comparison snapshot, browser download
  - Restore from backup (replace/merge), schema validation
  - Clear all data with confirmation

Phase 7 — PWA Polish:
  - usePWA composable (install prompt, SW update detection)
  - Install app button in header, update banner

Tags: mvp, vue3, budget, expenses, projection, import, comparison, export, pwa

commits.subject: fix(seed): version demo data so updates reach existing users
commits.body:
Previously, seedIfEmpty() checked only a localStorage flag. Once set,
demo data in IndexedDB was never refreshed — users who visited before
a demoData.ts update kept seeing stale content.

Now seedService stores DEMO_DATA_VERSION alongside the seeded flag.
On version mismatch, stale demo entries (ID prefix "demo-") are removed
and current data is re-inserted in a single transaction. User-created
data is preserved.

Tags: seed, demo-data, versioning

commits.subject: fix(conventions): rewrite import conventions with purpose context and examples
commits.body:
The convention text that users copy into AI prompts was a bare format
spec with no explanation of what Graphiki is, what happens with the
output, or why structure matters. The AI reading it had zero context
about purpose. Additionally, the JSON conventions referenced "Markdown
format" confusingly and required a `version` field that the import
service treats as optional.

Changes:
- Add PURPOSE_CONTEXT preamble shared across formats explaining what
  Graphiki is, how the output becomes an interactive knowledge graph,
  and why structure quality matters
- Rewrite JSON conventions with a concrete complete example (Google +
  Larry Page) instead of placeholder `[ ... ]` arrays
- Clarify that `content` "supports markdown formatting" within the
  string value, rather than the confusing "in Markdown format"
- Remove `version: "2"` from required fields (importExportService
  treats it as optional)
- Add tips section covering Unicode, paragraph breaks, source
  citation, and connection property guidance
- Rewrite Markdown conventions with enriched connections example,
  explicit tips, and same purpose context
- Add decision context comments explaining the design rationale

Tags: conventions, ai-prompt, import, documentation
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: conventions
Semver: minor

commits.subject: Merge pull request #28 from devmade-ai/claude/debug-graphiki-mobile-nxNZi
commits.body: Fix arc data migration for sourceId/targetId rename
commits.title: Merge pull request #28 from devmade-ai/claude/debug-graphiki-mobile-nxNZi

commits.subject: fix(db): restore version(1) and add v4 migration for sourceId→source rename
commits.body:
The v3 migration (commit 64f99ce) failed to migrate arc data from
sourceId/targetId to source/target for two reasons:

1. The version(1) declaration was removed in commit 65bdc4c, breaking
   the Dexie upgrade chain for users whose IndexedDB was created at v1.
   Without the v1 schema definition, Dexie cannot properly compute the
   upgrade path.

2. The v3 upgrade condition `!('source' in arc)` fails when Dexie adds
   an undefined `source` key during the v2 index rename — the `in`
   operator returns true even when the value is undefined, causing the
   migration to silently skip every arc.

Fixes:
- Restores the version(1) declaration with the original sourceId/targetId
  indexed schema so the full v1→v2→v3→v4 upgrade chain works.
- Adds version(4) with a robust migration using value-based checks
  (`!arc.source`) instead of key-existence checks. This catches all
  users — including those already at v3 whose data was never migrated.

Symptom: on mobile (Android Chrome 145), all 44 demo arcs logged
"Skipping arc — missing source or target" and the graph rendered
with nodes only, no edges.

Tags: db, migration, dexie, mobile, bug
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 5
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: alpha-stability
Semver: patch

https://claude.ai/code/session_01KJP9dXxJydNU5FbvFLSweK
commits.title: restore version(1) and add v4 migration for sourceId→source rename

commits.subject: fix(db): add Dexie v3 migration for sourceId/targetId → source/target data
commits.body:
The v2 schema bump (commit 65bdc4c) renamed the Dexie *indexes* from
sourceId/targetId to source/target but did not migrate the actual stored
objects. Users who visited before that rename have arcs in IndexedDB with
sourceId/targetId properties — arc.source is undefined, crashing
Cytoscape with "Can not create edge with unspecified source".

Adds a Dexie version 3 upgrade callback that renames sourceId→source
and targetId→target in all stored arcs. Also adds defensive filtering
in GraphCanvas to skip arcs with falsy or dangling source/target
references, logging skipped arcs via debugLog so the debug pill
surfaces the issue rather than silently swallowing it.

Tags: db, migration, cytoscape, defensive-coding
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 5
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: alpha-stability
Semver: patch

commits.subject: feat(query): add connect mode for dual-query path discovery
commits.body:
Users can now define two independent queries (A and B) and see how their
results connect across the graph. The mode toggle (Search / Connect) in
the QueryBuilder header switches between existing search and new connect
mode.

Connect mode features:
- Two pipeline panels (Find A / Connect to B) with full step support
- Connection settings: max hops (1–5) and arc-label exclusion checkboxes
- Bidirectional BFS engine (findConnections) finds bridge nodes
- Color-coded graph visualization: A=blue, B=green, bridge=orange,
  overlap=purple, connecting arcs=amber, internal arcs dimmed
- Dual result and analysis result are mutually exclusive overlays

Extracted QueryStepPanel as reusable component shared by both modes.
createStepOps() factory generates step CRUD callbacks bound to any
useState setter, avoiding callback duplication across three step arrays.

commits.subject: fix(query): improve query builder UX for non-technical users
commits.body:
Six fixes from a UX audit of the query builder:

1. Rename "Run" button to "Search" — plain language for non-technical users
2. Replace date-biased comparison operators ("is before"/"is after") with
   universal labels ("less than"/"greater than") that work for all types
3. Align help modal terminology with actual UI labels — "Has label" not
   "Label", "Connected by" not "Connection", operator names match dropdowns
4. Add mobile touch target overrides for all interactive elements that were
   below the 36-44px guideline (mode toggle, NOT, AND/OR, remove, add buttons)
5. Fix accessibility gaps: focus-visible on remove/action buttons, aria-labels
   on remove buttons, ARIA tab roles on help modal tabs
6. Add "no results" feedback message with plain-language guidance when a
   search returns zero matches

commits.subject: feat(query): add interactive query builder with relationship predicates and pipeline
commits.body:
Replace plain-text QueryBar with interactive QueryBuilder that supports visual
filter rows, pipeline chaining, and an advanced text mode. Extend the query
engine with relationship predicates (IN/OUT/CONN for arc-aware node filtering),
comparison operators (<, >, <=, >= with date/number/string auto-detection), and
a pipeline executor where each step narrows results while preserving full graph
context for relationship evaluation.

New files:
- QueryBuilder.tsx: Visual builder with filter rows, pipeline steps, dual mode
- QueryFilterRow.tsx: Individual filter row (label, property, title, relationship)
- QueryBuilder.css: Dark theme styles for builder components
- useGraphMetadata.ts: Hook extracting distinct labels/keys/values for autocomplete
- docs/working/interactive-query-builder.md: Architecture and design plan

Key design decisions:
- Builder produces AST directly via builderFilterToAST/builderStepToAST,
  bypassing text parsing for reliable structured query construction
- Pipeline executor uses full graph context (all arcs/nodes) for relationship
  predicates even when candidate nodes have been narrowed by prior steps
- Case-insensitive property key lookup in evaluator to handle parser lowercasing
  vs camelCase data model keys

Tags: query-builder, pipeline, relationship-predicates, interactive-ui

commits.subject: fix: use container height instead of document height for embed resize
commits.body:
The auto-height postMessage was measuring document.documentElement.scrollHeight
which included elements outside the embed container (#heatmap-tooltip div,
body pseudo-elements), reporting incorrect heights to the parent iframe.

Changes:
- Measure container.scrollHeight instead of document.documentElement.scrollHeight
- Delay initial height post by 100ms to let Chart.js finish first RAF render
- Track lastHeight to skip duplicate postMessage calls

commits.subject: feat(import): add pipe syntax and frontmatter connections to markdown import
commits.body:
Markdown import previously limited connections to auto-generated
"contains" (heading hierarchy) and "links to" (wiki-links) arcs with
no labels or properties. This meant all enriched connection metadata
required JSON format, undermining the recommended Markdown workflow.

Pipe syntax: [[Target|relationship title]]
  - Splits on first "|" — left = target name, right = relationship title
  - No pipe = default "links to" (backward compatible)
  - Example: [[Google|works at]] creates a "works at" arc

Frontmatter connections: block
  - Parsed from section-level YAML frontmatter
  - Each entry: to: (required), title: (optional), labels: (optional),
    plus any other key becomes a connection property
  - Example: connections: [{to: Acme, title: works at, role: CTO}]

Also fixes:
  - `tags:` now accepted as alias for `labels:` in frontmatter
    (guide told AIs to use `tags:` but code only recognized `labels:`)
  - `tags` and `connections` excluded from node properties (reserved keys)

16 new tests added (231 total, all passing).
Guide updated with both features: rules, template, tips, real-world
example, quick reference table, and connection metadata section.

Tags: import, markdown, connections, pipe-syntax, frontmatter

Urgency: 3

commits.subject: feat(import): add arc deduplication to merge service
commits.body:
Previously, arcs were blindly accepted on every import — re-importing
the same data created duplicate connections every time. Now arcs go
through the same new/duplicate/conflict detection as nodes.

Arc matching: after node matching builds an ID remap (imported → existing),
arc endpoints are remapped and compared against existing arcs by
source+target+normalized title. Direction matters; reversed endpoints
are treated as distinct.

Changes:
- mergeService: MergeArcItem now has existingMatch, status, propertyDiffs.
  buildMergeProposal accepts existingArcs parameter. getApprovedItems
  preserves existing arc ID for accepted conflicts.
- countByStatus returns nested { nodes, arcs } counts.

commits.subject: docs(guide): add tags vs properties decision guide
commits.body:
AI authors and users had no guidance on when to use tags (labels) vs
properties for item metadata. This led to inconsistent tagging, which
degrades import matching quality since tags are used for disambiguation.

Added a "Tags vs properties" section with:
- Clear distinction: tags = "what kind of thing" / properties = "facts about it"
- Decision rule: filter by it → tag, read it on detail card → property
- 10 concrete examples (Person, CEO, revenue, founded, etc.)
- Three tiebreaker rules for ambiguous cases

commits.subject: fix(import): handle multiple existing nodes with same title in merge
commits.body:
The merge service used Map<string, GraphNode> for title-based matching,
which silently dropped all but the last existing node when multiple shared
a title (e.g., "Apple" [Company] vs "Apple" [Fruit]). Imported "Apple"
would match whichever was stored last, ignoring labels entirely.

Now uses Map<string, GraphNode[]> and ranks candidates by label overlap:
exact label match first, then most shared labels, then first candidate
as fallback. Each imported node independently picks its best match.

Tags: import, merge, deduplication

commits.subject: fix(import): normalize JSON import to handle AI output guide format
commits.body:
The JSON import was blindly casting raw data as GraphNode[]/Arc[] without
transformation. When AI assistants followed the output guide (which uses
`tags`, `typeName`, `isSystemNode`, `schemas`, version "1"), the data
was silently malformed — `tags` were lost, `typeName` ignored, and
required fields like `labels`, `viewData`, `properties` left undefined.

Added normalization layer in validateJsonImport that:
- Maps `tags` → `labels` (AI guide uses `tags`, internal model uses `labels`)
- Maps `typeName` → appends to `labels` (type classification as label)
- Merges `labels` + `tags` + `typeName` with deduplication
- Defaults missing fields: labels=[], properties={}, viewData={},
  content='', contentType='text/markdown', timestamps=now
- Strips legacy fields (isSystemNode, isSystemArc, schemas)
- Accepts both version "1" (guide format) and "2" (native export)

Markdown and CSV imports were already correct — only JSON path was broken.

Tags: import, json, normalization, ai-guide, compatibility
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: import-compatibility
Semver: patch

commits.subject: feat(conventions): add strict naming and consistency rules for imports
commits.body:
Extracted a shared NAMING_CONVENTIONS block appended to both JSON and
Markdown convention content. The rules are prescriptive enough that two
independent AI sessions given the same real-world data should produce
identical titles, labels, arc titles, and property keys — enabling
reliable duplicate detection by the merge service.

Key additions:
- Title rules: most widely recognized name, no legal suffixes, no
  honorifics, no abbreviations unless the acronym IS the common name
- Label rules: singular PascalCase, standard vocabulary of 19 common
  labels, broad-over-narrow preference
- Arc title rules: lowercase verb phrases, active voice, present/past
  tense distinction, standard vocabulary of 26 common relationships
- Property rules: camelCase keys, standard vocabulary, typed values
  (real numbers, booleans, ISO dates, arrays instead of CSV strings)
- Deduplication guidance: reuse IDs for same entity, merge aliases,
  no duplicate arcs

Tags: conventions, naming, consistency, import, merge
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: conventions
Semver: minor

renders only the requested chart(s) with no header, tabs, sidebar, or
debug banner. Supports comma-separated IDs (?embed=id1,id2) for multiple
charts in a single iframe, and ?theme=light|dark for theme override.

New EmbedRenderer component maps embed IDs to tab components, renders
only the needed tabs (deduplicated), and uses useLayoutEffect to hide
non-target CollapsibleSections before paint. Invalid IDs show a helpful
error linking to EMBED_REFERENCE.md.

commits.subject: fix(ui): detail drawer opens on click, timeline dots aligned on line
commits.body:
Two bugs fixed:

1. Detail drawer never opened when clicking a node or arc. Root cause:
   cy.on('tap', handleTapBackground) fires on ALL taps, including
   bubbled events from nodes and edges. The background handler cleared
   the selection immediately after the node handler set it. Fix: check
   evt.target === cy before clearing selection.

2. Timeline marker dots were positioned ~15px to the right of the
   vertical track line. Root cause: negative margin math was incorrect
   under box-sizing: border-box (margin-left: -22px produced a dot
   center at 24px, but the line center is at 9px). Fix: switch to
   absolute positioning (left: -25px) for precise geometric alignment.

Tags: ui, graph-canvas, timeline, event-handling, css
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 4
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: polish
Semver: patch

commits.body:
Critical bugs:

  endpoint were incorrectly included in merge results

- useConventions: fix nested timeout leak on unmount + add save error handling

High (CLAUDE.md rule violations):
- ConnectNodeModal: move inline styles to CSS classes (connect-modal,
  modal-list-item.selected, modal-list-item-labels)
- ContextMenu: replace document.querySelector anti-pattern with useRef
- graphService: wrap emit() listener calls in try/catch to prevent one
  failing listener from breaking all subscribers
- Add :focus-visible styles on buttons, context menu items, modal list
  items, view switcher tabs, and timeline entries

Medium:
- App.tsx + DetailPanel.tsx: add try/catch with user-friendly error messages
  to all async operations (create, connect, duplicate, delete, save)
- Remove dead CSS classes (.modal-list-item-warning, .create-node-properties,
  .create-node-checkbox)
- Add --color-success/--color-success-hover CSS variables, replace hardcoded
  #059669/#047857 in btn-update
- Fix mobile touch targets below 44px for context-menu-item, modal-list-item,
  app-tab

Low:
- GraphCanvas: extract 11 magic numbers into named constants
- DebugPill.css: fix low-contrast text (#475569 → #64748b) for WCAG AA
- graphService: bulkDeleteNodes emits single data:changed instead of N
  individual events

commits.subject: fix(ui): resolve 7 UX/UI issues found during review
commits.body:
1. Node labels unreadable: Changed Cytoscape node label color from
   #1f2937 (near-black) to #e2e8f0 (light gray) so text is readable
   on the dark #0f172a canvas background.

2. btn-small class mismatch: DetailPanel used "btn-small" but CSS only
   defines "btn-sm". Renamed to btn-sm so property editor buttons
   (+ Add, ×) render with correct compact sizing.

3. Dead CSV CSS removed: Deleted ~110 lines of unused .import-csv-*
   and .csv-mapper-* styles left over from CSV import removal during
   Product Realignment.

4. Mobile menu touch-close: Added touchstart listener alongside
   mousedown so the hamburger dropdown closes when tapping outside
   on touch-only mobile devices.

5. Context menu off-screen: Added viewport bounds checking via ref
   callback that adjusts left/top when the menu would overflow the
   right or bottom viewport edge.

6. Arc creation UI: Added ConnectNodeModal with searchable node picker
   and optional relationship name. Accessible via "Connect to..." in
   the right-click/long-press context menu. Creates directed arc from
   source to selected target. Updated tutorial step 2 to reference
   the new connection flow.

7. Stale comment: Fixed App.tsx comment that still referenced
   "Upload/Query/Graph/Conventions" tabs (only Graph/Conventions exist).

Tags: ui, ux, accessibility, arc-creation, cleanup

Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: paid

commits.subject: feat(import): add merge review with duplicate/conflict detection
commits.body:
Phase 4 of the product realignment: import rework with merge system.

New files:
- mergeService.ts: Pure-function merge engine. Matches imported nodes
  to existing by normalized title. Categorizes as new/duplicate/conflict.
  Duplicate = same title+labels+content+properties. Conflict = same title,
  different data. Generates per-item property diffs. getApprovedItems()
  remaps IDs for conflict overwrites and filters accepted items.
- MergeReview.tsx + CSS: Three collapsible sections (New, Already Exists,
  Changed). Per-item checkboxes. Accept/Skip All bulk toggles. Property
  diffs shown inline for conflicts. Non-technical language throughout.
- mergeService.test.ts: 14 tests covering proposal building, status
  categorization, ID remapping, and count helpers.

ImportModal changes:
- Flow now: Upload → Parse → Merge Review → Import → Done
- CSV import removed (spec focuses on markdown from AI preprocessing)
- Visual preview step removed (merge review provides sufficient info)
- Merge review replaces direct-to-persist flow

Deleted files:
- CsvColumnMapper.tsx: No longer needed without CSV import
- ImportPreviewCanvas.tsx: No longer needed without visual preview step

commits.subject: refactor(core): migrate from schema-based to label-based data model
commits.body:
Replace the schema/type system with a simpler label-based model.
This is Phase 1 (Data Model Foundation) and Phase 2 (Layout Restructure)
of the product realignment plan.

Key changes:
- GraphNode/Arc use labels[] instead of typeId/tags
- Removed SchemaBlueprint, NodeType, ArcType, PropertyDefinition types
- Added ConventionRules type and AppTab union for tab navigation
- Database v2: dropped schemas table, renamed tag indexes to label indexes
- Factory functions simplified: removed createSchema, createNodeType, etc.
- Query engine uses label: prefix instead of type:/tag:
- Import/export uses 2-param exportToJson (no schemas), 1-param resolveMarkdownImport
- Snapshot service uses 2-param takeSnapshot (no schemas)
- useAppMode returns {activeTab, setActiveTab} instead of mode/schema state
- useGraphData simplified: no includeSystem parameter
- App.tsx rewritten with tab-based navigation (no designer/user mode)
- Removed: schema components, DesignerPanel, ConnectModal, KanbanView,
  ListView, TableView, ViewBuilder, ViewConfigEditor
- Graph coloring uses label-hash-based palette instead of schema types
- All 166 tests pass, lint clean, build succeeds

Tags: product-realignment, phase-1, phase-2, labels, migration
Complexity: 5
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: high
Debt: paid
Epic: product-realignment
Semver: major

commits.body:
Adds typeResolutionService that post-processes import results to auto-create
missing node types, arc types, and infer property definitions. Runs as pure
functions between parsing and persistence, preserving existing function purity.

Markdown import: `type: Person` in frontmatter now auto-creates a "Person"
NodeType if it doesn't exist. Arc labels ("contains", "links to") become
ArcTypes. Frontmatter keys (role, department, etc.) are inferred as string
PropertyDefinitions on auto-created types.

JSON import: Optional `typeName` field on nodes/arcs enables name-based type
resolution (extracted as hints in ImportResult, keeping GraphNode clean).
Valid typeId takes precedence over typeName.

When no schema is active, a new schema is created (named after the import
file) and set as active. Undo import restores the previous active schema.

ImportModal shows informational banner about auto-created types in the
visual preview step before the user approves.

commits.body:
The legacy `builds` property in vercel.json combined with api/package.json
caused Vercel to treat the api/ directory as a single function unit (only
exposing index.ts), making /api/health and /api/send-interest return 404.

- Add `framework: null` to prevent framework auto-detection
- Delete api/package.json (redundant — root package.json already provides

   fail. Added a no-op build script since serverless functions

commits.subject: fix(interest-form): detect API-not-deployed and show actionable errors
commits.body:
Root cause: Vercel logs show all requests to /api/send-interest return
404 — the API serverless functions are not deployed. Vercel serves 404
without CORS headers, so the browser throws "TypeError: Failed to fetch"
which is indistinguishable from a network failure on mobile Chrome.

Three changes:

1. DebugBanner diagnostics: Add "API Deployed" check that hits the
   /api/health endpoint before checking CORS. When health returns 404,
   the diagnostic clearly shows "API not deployed — redeploy with:
   cd api && npx vercel --prod". CORS check is skipped when not deployed
   to avoid a confusing secondary failure.

2. InterestForm error handling: Replace single CORS probe with
   three-phase diagnoseFailure() that distinguishes not-deployed (health
   endpoint 404), CORS misconfigured (health OK but form fetch blocked),
   and network failure (server unreachable). Each gets a specific
   user-facing message.

3. api/vercel.json: Remove legacy "builds" configuration in favor of
   Vercel zero-config auto-detection. The legacy format can cause
   deployment issues and is no longer needed for the api/ directory
   structure.

Tags: vercel, deployment, debug, cors, error-handling

commits.subject: fix(interest-form): resolve mobile Chrome CORS/SW fetch failures
commits.body:
Three changes to fix "Failed to fetch" TypeErrors on mobile Chrome:

1. Add explicit NetworkOnly runtimeCaching strategy for Vercel API
   endpoints in the service worker config. The navigateFallbackDenylist
   only controls navigation fallback — it does not prevent the SW fetch
   handler from intercepting cross-origin requests, which can break
   CORS preflight on some mobile Chrome versions.

2. Add CORS-aware error detection in InterestForm: after all fetch
   attempts fail with TypeError, a mode:'no-cors' probe differentiates
   "server unreachable" from "CORS misconfigured", giving users a more
   actionable error message instead of the generic network error.

3. Split DebugBanner "API Reachable" diagnostic into two checks:
   a no-cors reachability probe and a cors OPTIONS request. This
   separates network failures from CORS misconfigurations in the
   diagnostics panel, making future debugging clearer.

Tags: pwa, cors, mobile, service-worker, debug
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: paid
Epic: interest-form
Semver: patch

after 628ms with API Reachable diagnostic also failing. Root cause is
likely transient mobile network failure or CORS preflight rejection.

- Set explicit mode: 'cors' on fetch for mobile browser compat

  worker from interfering with cross-origin API requests
- Differentiate error messages: offline, connection dropped, server
  unreachable (with actionable guidance for each)
- Log attempt numbers and retry state in debug events

modeled after PWADebugBanner from another project. The system has three
parts:

1. debugLog utility (src/utils/debugLog.ts) — pub/sub in-memory event
   store capped at 200 entries. Global singleton so logs survive
   component re-renders. Any module can call debugLog() to emit events.

2. DebugBanner component (src/components/DebugBanner.tsx) — floating
   pill on the bottom-right that expands to a two-tab panel:
   - Diagnostics tab: runs health checks (HTTPS, network, API URL
     config, API reachability, service worker, install state, user agent)
   - Event Log tab: real-time color-coded entries from InterestForm
     (info=gray, success=green, warn=amber, error=red) with expandable
     details and source labels
   Controls: re-run diagnostics, clear log, copy-all-to-clipboard, close
   Clipboard fallback: shows selectable textarea if API fails on mobile

3. InterestForm integration — emits debugLog events at each lifecycle
   point: submit, request, response-ok, response-error, timeout,
   fetch-failed, api-url-missing, honeypot-triggered

Activated via ?debug=true URL parameter. Hidden from regular users.
The "Copy All" button produces a complete plain-text report (environment
+ full event log) formatted for pasting into another session.

commits.subject: refactor(debug): replace modal with one-tap copy debug report
commits.body:
The previous debug modal required opening a scrollable log, finding
entries, and copying them individually — too many steps on mobile.

Replaced with a single "Copy Debug Report" button that copies a
complete plain-text diagnostic report to clipboard in one tap.
The report includes environment (URL, user agent), API endpoint,
request summary, HTTP response (status, body, elapsed time), and
error details — formatted for pasting into another session to
diagnose email sending issues.

commits.subject: fix(review): resolve remaining design issues, add service + hook tests
commits.body:
Design fixes:
- deleteNode now emits arc:deleted for each cascade-deleted arc instead
  of silently bulk-deleting. Collects arc IDs first, then deletes and
  emits per-arc events so arc-specific listeners stay consistent.
- loadAllData now filters system nodes/arcs via getAllNodes/getAllArcs
  instead of raw db.toArray(), preventing system items from leaking
  into the graph canvas and views.
- getAllNodes/getAllArcs changed from .where().equals(0) to .filter()
  for boolean isSystem fields — .equals(0) fails in fake-indexeddb
  which preserves JS booleans instead of coercing to 0/1.
- Analysis panel source/target validated against current filtered nodes
  via derived validSourceId/validTargetId. Stale selections (from nodes
  removed by query filter) are treated as empty, disabling Run button.
- Config changed from eager module-load evaluation to lazy Proxy-based
  access. window.__GRAPHIKI_CONFIG__ is now read on first property access,
  supporting override scripts loaded after the app bundle.

New tests (48 added, 109 → 157):
- graphService: 22 tests covering CRUD, events, cascade delete,
  system filtering, bulk upsert, event unsubscribe
- viewService: 10 tests covering CRUD, events, unsubscribe
- useSelection: 7 tests covering all selection state transitions
- useAppMode: 9 tests covering mode toggle, schema persistence,
  localStorage read/write, null handling

Dev dependency added: fake-indexeddb (in-memory IndexedDB for tests)

Tags: review, bugfix, tests, services, hooks
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 3
Impact: internal
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: quality-review
Semver: patch

commits.subject: fix(review): fix 4 bugs, 3 cleanups, add 6 tests from 6-phase review
commits.body:
Bug fixes:
- JSON import now uses bulkPut (upsert) instead of add, preventing
  ConstraintError on duplicate IDs when re-importing the same file.
  Added bulkUpsertNodes/Arcs/Schemas to service layer.
- queryResultCount derived from inline queryResult instead of computed
  separately in handleRunQuery callback. Previous approach could show
  a count that didn't match the actually-rendered filtered data when
  nodes/arcs changed between callback run and next render.
- Betweenness centrality normalization corrected from (n-1)*(n-2) to
  (n-1)*(n-2)/2 for undirected graphs. Previous normalization produced
  values 2x too high because each pair is traversed from both directions.

Cleanups:
- Merged duplicate .modal-list-item CSS rule into single declaration.
- Removed unused `arcs` prop from KanbanView, TableView, ViewContainer.

Tests:
- Added 6 tests for autoSuggestMappings (title/name/label mapping,
  tags/labels/categories, ID skipping, schema property matching,
  fallback to lowercase, empty headers).

109 tests passing, lint clean, build clean.

commits.subject: fix(pwa): prevent setInterval leak in usePWAUpdate hook
commits.body:
The original code called setInterval directly inside the onRegistered
callback. Since onRegistered fires on every component mount, this
leaked intervals on remounts (React Strict Mode, hot reload, etc.)
with no cleanup path.

Move interval management into a useEffect with a cleanup function
that calls clearInterval on unmount. The SW registration is stored
in a ref and a boolean state flag triggers the effect.

commits.subject: feat(analysis): add Phase 5 graph analysis algorithms + visualization
commits.body:
Implements six graph algorithms as pure functions on adjacency lists,
with a collapsible UI panel for running them and visual overlays on
the graph canvas for displaying results.

Algorithms implemented:
- Degree centrality: identifies hub nodes by connection count
- Betweenness centrality (Brandes): finds bridge nodes between clusters
- PageRank (power iteration): ranks nodes by network influence
- Connected components (BFS): partitions graph into disconnected groups
- Shortest path (BFS): finds shortest route between two selected nodes
- Clustering coefficient: measures local triangle density

Visualization:
- Score-based node sizing (30-70px scaled by normalized score)
- Path highlighting with accent color on nodes and arcs
- Component coloring with 10-color palette
- Non-highlighted elements dimmed to 20% opacity
- Cytoscape class-based styling (analysis-dimmed, analysis-highlighted)

UI:
- AnalysisPanel with algorithm dropdown, description, source/target pickers
- Top-20 results table sorted by score
- Path display with arrow notation
- Component count summary
- Collapsible panel (visible only in graph view)

Also removes stale reference to nonexistent docs/EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md.

Test coverage: 103 total (29 new analysis tests covering all algorithms
with star/chain/triangle/disconnected graph fixtures).

Tags: phase-5, analysis, algorithms, centrality, pagerank, pathfinding

Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing

commits.subject: fix: resolve 5 race conditions and replace hacks with proper solutions
commits.body:
Race conditions fixed:
- useMessages: stale closure in sendMessage via messagesRef
- useMessages: polling version counter to skip stale results
- useMessages: subscribe-before-fetch to close subscription gap
- useChats: debounce + fetch counter for concurrent fetchChats
- useReactions: pending ops tracking to prevent realtime double-count

Hacks replaced:
- onesignal: OneSignalDeferred callbacks instead of 100ms polling loop
- onesignal: state-checking loop instead of arbitrary setTimeout(500)
- ComposeBar: requestAnimationFrame instead of setTimeout(100)
- home: removed temporary PWADebugBanner component

Code quality:
- Extracted magic numbers to named constants across 6 files
- Added "Fix root causes" principle to CLAUDE.md

commits.subject: fix: static import pwa.js — no race condition, no globals
commits.body:
The dynamic import meant beforeinstallprompt could fire before pwa.js
loaded. Previous "fix" added a window.__pwaInstallPrompt global hack
across three files. Proper fix: static import in main.jsx. Module loads
synchronously, listener is ready before the browser fires the event.

commits.subject: fix: install button race condition + interactive debug banner
commits.body:
beforeinstallprompt could fire before pwa.js was dynamically imported,
causing the install prompt to be lost. Now captured early in main.jsx
(synchronous, before React renders) and stored on window.__pwaInstallPrompt.
Header checks for already-captured prompt on mount. pwa.js reads it on load.

(SW support, controller status, standalone mode, install prompt state,
user agent) with Copy and Close buttons.

commits.subject: fix: stop silently swallowing data loading errors causing black screen
commits.body:
The loading indicator flashed briefly then disappeared into a black screen
because .catch(() => {}) silently swallowed ALL fetch errors — not just the
expected 404 when no data file exists. Network failures, JSON parse errors,
and CORS issues were all hidden, leaving users with an invisible DropZone
on the dark background.

Changes:
- Only treat HTTP 404 as expected (no data file); show error card + retry
  button for all other failures
- Add dashboard-enter fade-in animation (0.3s) for smooth loading transition
- Fix PWA dynamic import to properly catch promise rejection
- Make DropZone more visible with title heading and vertical centering

https://claude.ai/code/session_01EonWf8AagsDmpDkFMoUmq7
commits.title: stop silently swallowing data loading errors causing black screen

render, or the loading spinner was too subtle. Three layers of defense:

commits.subject: fix: back button and deep link navigation for join flow
commits.body:
Back buttons on join/create screens used router.back() which fails when
the screen is the entry point (opened via shared link). Deep link handler
also caused double navigation on web since Expo Router already handles
URL routing. Both issues could crash the app or strand users.

- Replace router.back() with router.replace('/home') on all cancel buttons
- Skip initial URL handling on web (Expo Router handles it already)
- Use router.replace() instead of push() in deep link handler
- Add back button to validation loading state on join/[code]
- Show user-friendly error on joinChat race conditions

commits.subject: fix: convert all scripts to ESM, fix command injection, extract shared modules
commits.body:
Security fixes:
- Replace all execSync() with execFileSync() in extract.js, extract-api.js,
  and fix-malformed.js — eliminates shell injection risk by passing args as
  arrays instead of interpolated strings
- Add SHA validation in fix-malformed.js before using in git commands

ESM conversion:
- Convert all 11 scripts from CommonJS (require) to ESM (import/export)
- Add __dirname workaround where needed (extract-api.js, aggregate-processed.js,
  migrate-batches-to-commits.js)
- Fix update-all.sh inline node command to use --input-type=module with
  JSON.parse instead of require()

Shared modules (scripts/lib/):
- manifest.js: getManifestPath, readManifest, writeManifest, PROCESSED_DIR
  (was duplicated across 5 files)
- commit-parsing.js: parseCommitMessage, extractBreakingChange,
  extractReferences (was duplicated in extract.js and extract-api.js)
- stdin.js: readStdin (was duplicated across 3 files)
- utils.js: toKebabCase, writeJson (was duplicated across 4 files)

Net: -211 lines (325 deleted, 114 added in scripts + 4 new lib files)
All scripts pass syntax checks. Dashboard build unchanged.

handler registers, breaking PWA caching and installability. Now degrades
gracefully: PWA features work, only push notifications degrade.

commits.subject: Fix reader mode canvas not using available space
commits.body:
The ResizeObserver tracking container width was set up with an empty
dependency array, so it only observed the editor mode's DOM element.
When switching to reader mode, the ref pointed to a new DOM element
but the observer was still watching the old (removed) one, causing
containerWidth to go stale. This made the canvas render much smaller
than the available viewport.

Adding isReaderMode to the dependency array ensures the observer
re-attaches to the correct DOM element on mode switch.

https://claude.ai/code/session_01Mf3ye3eTc6NcnAQYzK82xE
commits.title: Fix reader mode canvas not using available space

commits.subject: fix: merge OneSignal into sw.js to fix PWA install prompt on Chrome
commits.body:
Chrome showed "Add to Home screen" instead of "Install app" because
beforeinstallprompt never fired. Root cause: OneSignal SDK registered
OneSignalSDKWorker.js at scope /, replacing sw.js as the active service
worker. Since OneSignalSDKWorker.js has no fetch handler, Chrome didn't
consider the site an installable PWA.

Fix: import OneSignal SDK directly into sw.js via importScripts() and
configure OneSignal init() with serviceWorkerPath: '/sw.js' so it uses
our SW instead of registering its own. Removed duplicate push handlers
from sw.js (OneSignal SDK handles those). Bumped cache version to v7.

https://claude.ai/code/session_01XxJYwPmaaPobqUUoDbvqrB
commits.title: merge OneSignal into sw.js to fix PWA install prompt on Chrome

commits.subject: fix: make install/update buttons truly exclusive by audience
commits.body:
- Update: only shows for installed PWA users (isInstalled && hasUpdate)
- Install: only shows for non-installed users (!isInstalled && shouldShowInstall)

Browser users don't need "Update" since network-first caching means
hard reload already gets the latest code. The SW update is only
meaningful for installed PWAs where the SW controls the experience.

commits.subject: fix: add text labels to PWA install/update buttons, make mutually exclusive
commits.body:
Install and update buttons now show "Install" / "Update" text alongside
their icons for better discoverability. They are mutually exclusive -
update takes priority when both conditions are true (update available
trumps install prompt).

https://claude.ai/code/session_012nvsRGG6qvCXSbHiTPwmgX
commits.title: add text labels to PWA install/update buttons, make mutually exclusive

commits.subject: fix: use network-first caching for JS/CSS so hard reload gets latest code
commits.body:
The service worker was using stale-while-revalidate for JS/CSS, which
returns cached content before checking the network. This meant hard
reload (Ctrl+Shift+R) still served stale app code from CacheStorage,
since CacheStorage is separate from the browser HTTP cache.

Changed to network-first: always fetch latest from network, only fall
back to cache when offline. Bumped cache version to v6 to clear stale
caches for existing users. Also fixed "banner" references to "button"
in docs and sw.js comments.

https://claude.ai/code/session_012nvsRGG6qvCXSbHiTPwmgX
commits.title: use network-first caching for JS/CSS so hard reload gets latest code

commits.subject: docs: update HISTORY.md with PWA install fix details

commits.title: update HISTORY.md with PWA install fix details

commits.subject: fix: register service worker early in root layout for PWA installability
commits.body:
The service worker was only being registered when the home screen mounted
(via usePWAUpdate hook), which happens after auth initialization completes.
Chrome requires a controlling service worker before firing the
beforeinstallprompt event that enables PWA installation.

By registering at module load time in the root layout, the SW is available
before React even mounts, giving Chrome enough time to evaluate
installability criteria. The register() call is idempotent, so
usePWAUpdate in home.tsx still works correctly with the same registration.

https://claude.ai/code/session_012nvsRGG6qvCXSbHiTPwmgX
commits.title: register service worker early in root layout for PWA installability

commits.subject: docs: update HISTORY.md with simplified PWA update fix
commits.body: https://claude.ai/code/session_01YbKxdaTUQVeq8u4arrhstf
commits.title: update HISTORY.md with simplified PWA update fix

commits.subject: fix: simplify PWA update logic to eliminate race conditions
commits.body:
The previous implementation had multiple layers of flags (sessionStorage,
statechange listeners, suppressUpdateBannerRef) trying to work around
race conditions that resulted from the fundamental approach.

The new approach is simpler and more reliable:
1. Register SW and detect waiting workers normally
2. On update click: send SKIP_WAITING, set flag, clear UI state
3. Reload ONLY on controllerchange AND only if user initiated

Key changes:
- Removed sessionStorage UPDATE_RELOAD_KEY hack
- Removed statechange listener waiting for 'activated'
- Use controllerchange as the sole reload trigger
- Single userClickedUpdateRef flag gates reload behavior
- Bumped SW cache version to v5 for clean slate

https://claude.ai/code/session_01YbKxdaTUQVeq8u4arrhstf
commits.title: simplify PWA update logic to eliminate race conditions

commits.subject: fix: wait for service worker activation before reload

This fix properly waits for the waiting worker to reach 'activated' state
before reloading the page, ensuring registration.waiting is cleared.

- Use statechange event on waiting worker to detect full activation
- Only reload when worker.state === 'activated'
- Clear waitingWorkerRef and hasUpdate before reload
- Simplified controllerchange handler (now just clears state)

commits.subject: Add semantic color tokens for light/dark mode
commits.body:
Created CSS variables and Tailwind tokens for consistent theming:

CSS Variables (in index.css):
- --color-text-default/muted/subtle/faint for text
- --color-surface/elevated/inset/hover for backgrounds
- --color-border/subtle/strong for borders

Tailwind Config (ui namespace):
- text-ui-text, text-ui-text-muted, etc.
- bg-ui-surface, bg-ui-surface-elevated, etc.
- border-ui-border, border-ui-border-subtle, etc.

Refactored components to use semantic classes instead of
paired light/dark classes (e.g., text-ui-text-muted instead
of text-zinc-600 dark:text-zinc-300).

This makes color maintenance easier and ensures consistency.

https://claude.ai/code/session_01AQxUcta7zmziDFsrmzzuTm
commits.title: Add semantic color tokens for light/dark mode

commits.subject: Rename Complete Designs to Looks with simplified presets
commits.body:
Replace complex style presets with focused "Looks" that only apply:
- Overlay (type, color, opacity)
- Fonts (title/body)
- Text alignment (horizontal/vertical)
- Image filters (grayscale, sepia, blur, contrast, brightness)

Looks no longer change theme or layout structure - those are now
independent preset categories in the Presets tab.

commits.subject: Restructure to image-first workflow
commits.body:
- Settings (fit, position, filters) now stored per-image instead of per-cell
- New workflow: upload images → select image → apply settings → assign to cells
- Image library shows selected image with highlight
- Assign to Cells section lets you toggle cell assignments for selected image
- Same image in multiple cells shares the same settings
- Updated useAdState, MediaTab, AdCanvas for new data structure
commits.title: Restructure to image-first workflow

commits.subject: Restructure Media tab to upload-first workflow
commits.body:
- Upload area now at the top to build image library first
- Support for multiple file uploads (click or drag & drop)
- Image library shows all uploaded images with cell assignment indicators
- Cell assignment section appears after images are uploaded
- Clearer workflow: upload images → assign to cells → adjust settings
commits.title: Restructure Media tab to upload-first workflow

commits.subject: Add multi-image system and frame borders
commits.body:
Multi-image system:
- Image library: Upload multiple images to shared pool
- Per-cell assignment: Assign different images to different cells
- Per-cell settings: fit, position, filters per image
- Redesigned MediaTab with cell selector and image library

Frame system:
- Outer frame: Colored border around entire canvas
- Per-cell frames: Colored borders within individual cells
- Frame width as percentage of padding (keeps dimensions stable)
- Controls added to Style > Spacing section

Breaking changes:
- Removed: image, imageObjectFit, imagePosition, imageFilters, layout.imageCell
- Added: images[], cellImages{}, frame{}
commits.title: Add multi-image system and frame borders

commits.subject: feat: add role-based view levels (Executive/Management/Developer)
commits.body:
Add view level selector that changes data granularity for different audiences
while keeping the same dashboard layout:

- Executive: aggregated totals, weekly heatmap, summary-only drilldowns
- Management: per-repo groupings, daily heatmap, summary drilldowns
- Developer: individual contributors, hourly heatmap, full commit lists (default)

Implementation includes:
- VIEW_LEVELS config with granularity settings per level
- Aggregation functions (aggregateContributors, aggregateForDrilldown, etc.)
- Modified renderContributors to use aggregation layer
- Modified detail pane to show summaries for non-developer views
- Added renderWeeklyHeatmap and renderDailyHeatmap for different time views
- UI selector in filter sidebar with localStorage persistence

Filters still apply across all view levels. Layout remains consistent.
commits.title: add role-based view levels (Executive/Management/Developer)

commits.subject: fix: simplify web scroll preservation with DOM-based approach
commits.body:
Replace fragile pixel-based scroll restoration with message ID anchoring:
- Add data-message-id attribute to MessageBubbleWeb for DOM queries
- Use scrollIntoView({ block: 'end', behavior: 'instant' }) for reliable positioning
- Remove triple requestAnimationFrame timing hack
- Capture anchor message ID before loading, restore after loading completes

This eliminates timing races and makes scroll preservation height-independent.

https://claude.ai/code/session_013jBQdfLFpeMtQM7eEiaR7D
commits.title: simplify web scroll preservation with DOM-based approach

commits.subject: fix: improve scroll position preservation when loading older messages
commits.body:
- Capture pre-load scroll state before triggering pagination
- Wait for loading to complete AND content height increase before restoring
- Use triple requestAnimationFrame for reliable layout completion
- Add 500ms cleanup timeout for edge cases (empty responses, failures)
- Fix diagonal scrolling accidentally triggering long-press action sheet
  by canceling timer on any movement >10px

commits.subject: perf: fix chat scrolling lag and improve responsiveness
commits.body:
- MessageBubble: Use refs instead of state for isSwiping to prevent
  event listener re-registration on every swipe state change
- MessageBubble: Wrap components with React.memo to prevent unnecessary
  re-renders when parent state changes
- useMessages: Increase polling interval from 5s to 30s (realtime is
  primary, polling is just a fallback)
- useMessages: Simplify polling logic and remove excessive console.log
  statements that add overhead
- chat/[id]: Simplify onContentSizeChange handler by removing double
  requestAnimationFrame and direct DOM manipulation for scroll behavior

commits.subject: feat: add .env file support for GH_TOKEN authentication
commits.body:

This adds custom touch event handling to detect pull gestures at the top

- Add touch event listeners for touchstart/touchmove/touchend on web
- Track scroll position to detect when user is at top of list
- Show animated pull indicator with threshold feedback
- Trigger window.location.reload when threshold is reached
- Keep native RefreshControl for iOS/Android platforms
commits.title: implement web pull-to-refresh on home screen

commits.subject: fix: capture validation failures for reprocessing instead of skipping
commits.body:
Both scripts now write malformed commits to needs-reprocess.json files
instead of silently skipping them:

save-commit.js:
- Validates all required fields before saving
- Valid commits are saved, invalid ones written to needs-reprocess.json
- Exits with error if any commits failed validation
- Clear error messages explaining what went wrong

aggregate-processed.js:
- Loudly reports all malformed commits during aggregation
- Writes them to processed/<repo>/needs-reprocess.json
- Shows warning at end of output

This ensures validation failures are visible and actionable rather
than silently lost.

https://claude.ai/code/session_01GTJnfM2q8ybazZtZ1Y54fg
commits.title: capture validation failures for reprocessing instead of skipping

commits.subject: fix: add validation to save-commit.js to prevent incomplete saves
commits.body:
Root cause of malformed commits: when AI analyzed batches, it only
output analysis fields instead of complete commit objects. Without
validation, these incomplete commits were saved to processed/.

Now save-commit.js validates:
- Required metadata: sha, timestamp, subject
- Required author: author_id or author
- Required analysis: tags, complexity, urgency, impact

Fails fast with clear error message if any fields are missing.

https://claude.ai/code/session_01GTJnfM2q8ybazZtZ1Y54fg
commits.title: add validation to save-commit.js to prevent incomplete saves

Complete visual redesign following the Koinz Style Guide specification:

- Dark-only theme with Koinz color palette (#1B1B1B background, #2a2a2a cards, #2D68FF primary)

commits.subject: fix: remove broken security-count reference in renderSecurity()
commits.body:
The renderSecurity() function was trying to update a non-existent element 'security-count', causing a TypeError that stopped execution of applyFilters(). Since renderSummary() is called after renderSecurity() in applyFilters(), the Overview tab never updated when filters changed.

The security count is already correctly handled by renderHealth() via the 'health-security-count' element, so the broken line was simply removed.

commits.subject: fix: apply author identity mapping in aggregation
commits.body:
The author-map.json config existed but wasn't being used during data aggregation. Now the aggregate script:

- Loads config/author-map.json at startup
- Resolves raw emails to canonical author IDs
- Normalizes author_id in all commits
- Merges contributor stats by canonical ID
- Includes metadata.authors for dashboard resolution

Result: jacotheron87's two email addresses are now properly merged into a single contributor (4 total instead of 5).

commits.subject: feat: global filters across all dashboard tabs
commits.body:
- Move filter bar above tabs (always visible)
- Add filter indicator showing "X of Y" when active
- Apply filters to all tabs (Work, Health, etc.) not just Activity
- Update all render functions to use getFilteredCommits()
- Preserve filter state across repo switches with validation

Previously filters only affected the commit list on the Activity tab. Now all charts, stats, and breakdowns respect the active filters.

commits.subject: Simplify orientation to manual selection instead of platform-derived
commits.body:
Users typically export to multiple platforms, so deriving aspect ratio from
the current platform selection wasn't helpful. Now uses simple Landscape /
Portrait / Square buttons that the user selects based on their target formats.

- Removed platform-based format detection
- Added orientation selector with 3 options
- Updated USER_GUIDE.md with new workflow

commits.subject: Improve AI Prompt Helper UX for first-time users
commits.body:
- Show helpful message when theme not yet selected (instead of confusing state)
- Mark Colors as "(optional)" since prompt works without it
- Add hint that theme comes from Style tab
- Add hint that platform comes from Export section
- Add "Updates as you change options" label to clarify live preview

commits.subject: Add AI Image Prompt Helper to Media tab
commits.body:
Adds a collapsible section (collapsed by default) to help users generate
prompts for AI image generation tools. Features:

- Subject/context description input
- Style options (Photo, Cinematic, Editorial, Minimal, Abstract, etc.)
- Mood/lighting options (Dark, Light, Neutral, Dramatic, Soft, Warm, Cool)
- Image purpose toggle (Hero Image vs Background for text overlays)
- Color options (use current theme colors or custom description)
- Auto-detected format from selected platform (orientation, aspect ratio)
- Generated prompt always includes "no text/overlays" constraints
- Copy button with visual feedback

Also updates USER_GUIDE.md with documentation for the new feature.

commits.subject: fix: normalize data field formats in dashboard
commits.body:
Add helper functions to handle inconsistent field formats:
- getCommitSubject(): handles subject vs message
- getAdditions(): handles stats.additions vs lines_added
- getDeletions(): handles stats.deletions vs lines_deleted

This ensures all 576 commits display correctly regardless of which extraction format they came from.

commits.subject: fix: dashboard Files Changed showing 0
commits.body:
Add getFilesChanged() helper to handle multiple data formats:
- stats.filesChanged (new extractions)
- files_changed (snake_case, older commits)

Now correctly shows 1,689 files changed across 576 commits.

commits.body: Fix black downloads by overriding opacity in toPng capture

commits.subject: Fix black downloads by overriding opacity in toPng capture
commits.body:
The canvas was hidden (opacity: 0) during export to prevent visual
flashing, but html-to-image clones elements with computed styles.
Added style override to ensure cloned element has opacity: 1.

commits.subject: refactor: migrate from batch files to individual commit files
commits.body:
Store each analyzed commit as a separate JSON file instead of batching 15 commits per file. This simplifies deduplication (file existence = processed), enables atomic edits, and produces cleaner git diffs.

Changes:
- Add scripts/save-commit.js for saving individual commits
- Add scripts/migrate-batches-to-commits.js for one-time migration
- Update scripts/aggregate-processed.js to read from commits/
- Update scripts/extract.js to write individual commit files
- Migrate all 4 repos (576 commits total)
- Delete old batches/ directories

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: feat: implement Negotiation Mode UI changes
commits.body:
Based on Discovery Framework findings, implement "Simplified by Default" approach
for client-facing negotiation sessions.

Input Field Enhancements:
- Add benchmark property for industry standard badges (e.g., "Industry: 5-15%")
- Add essential property to control field grouping
- InputField displays benchmark badges next to labels

Calculator Page Refactor:
- Progressive disclosure: Essential inputs visible, Advanced collapsed
- Sensitivity/Projections moved to collapsible "Advanced Analysis" section
- Transfer Pricing collapsed by default (shows risk badge)
- One-click save with auto-generated names
- Saved options count shown in action bar

This aligns with the 5 design principles from discovery:
1. Client in the room - cleaner, less overwhelming UI
2. Neutral ground first - industry benchmarks prominently displayed
3. Show both sides - Developer/Buyer results always visible
4. Progressive complexity - advanced features tucked away
5. Compare to decide - prominent save, easy comparison flow
commits.title: implement Negotiation Mode UI changes

commits.subject: feat: add aggregation script for processed data with urgency/impact
commits.body:
New script reads AI-analyzed commits from processed/<repo>/batches/
and generates dashboard-ready JSON with full aggregations:

- tagBreakdown, complexityBreakdown (existing)
- urgencyBreakdown, impactBreakdown (NEW)
- Monthly aggregations with avgUrgency, impact distribution
- Contributor aggregations with avgUrgency, impactBreakdown

Output structure:
- dashboard/data.json (overall, all repos combined)
- dashboard/repos/<repo>.json (per-repo, same schema)

Both views use identical schema enabling consistent dashboard code.
commits.title: add aggregation script for processed data with urgency/impact

commits.subject: docs: complete Dashboard V2 design specification
commits.body:
New hybrid dashboard architecture combining logical groupings with
contextual detail pane. Reduces cognitive load (4 tabs instead of 7)
while enabling in-context drill-down.

Key design decisions:
- Overview/Activity/Work/Health tab structure

commits.subject: feat: add incremental processing support for "feed the chicken"
commits.body:
Add manifest-based tracking to enable resumable batch processing:
- scripts/pending.js: Generates pending batches by comparing manifests
  against extracted commits. Supports --rebuild-manifests flag.
- scripts/manifest-update.js: Updates manifest after batch approval
- processed/<repo>/manifest.json: Tracks processed SHAs (source of truth)
- pending/<repo>/batches/: Generated batches of unprocessed commits only

This allows "feed the chicken" to work correctly even after merging
and starting a new session - only truly new/unprocessed commits will
be presented for review.

Updated EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md with new workflow documentation.
commits.title: add incremental processing support for "feed the chicken"

commits.subject: feat: add urgency and impact dimensions to commit analysis schema
commits.body:
Two new dimensions for richer commit insights:

Urgency (1-5): How critical was the change?
- Captures reactive vs planned work patterns
- Helps identify operational health (high urgency = problems)

Impact (internal/user-facing/infrastructure/api): Who is affected?
- Shows where effort goes
- Distinguishes building vs maintaining vs supporting

commits.subject: docs: comprehensive 55+ tag list for commit analysis
commits.body:
Expanded from 11 generic tags to 55+ specific tags across categories:
- User-facing: feature, enhancement, bugfix, hotfix, ui, ux, accessibility, i18n, localization
- Code: refactor, simplify, removal, deprecation, migration, naming, types
- Performance: performance, memory, caching
- Security: security, auth, authorization, vulnerability, sanitization
- Testing: test-unit, test-integration, test-e2e, test-fix, coverage, mocks
- Docs: docs, changelog, comments, api-docs, examples
- Infra: ci, cd, docker, monitoring, hosting
- Build: build, bundler, config, env, lint, formatter
- Deps: dependency-add, dependency-update, dependency-remove, dependency-security
- Database: database, schema, data-migration, seed
- API: api, api-breaking, endpoint
- Git: merge, revert, release, init
- Style: style, imports, whitespace
- Errors: error-handling, logging, validation

AI reads full commit body and assigns ALL applicable tags.

commits.subject: docs: add research items for commit model improvements
commits.body:
New Research/Investigation section in TODO.md:

1. Device/Platform Attribution
   - Split contributions by committer name (mobile vs desktop)
   - Config mapping for name variations with device tags

2. AI-Powered Commit Categorization
   - Claude reads commit messages + diffs to understand intent
   - Auto-tagging beyond conventional commit types
   - Confidence scores and human override

3. Multi-Tag Commit Model
   - One commit can have multiple tags (feat + refactor + docs)
   - Schema change from single type to tags[] with weights
   - Backward compatibility with existing data

4. Tag-Centric Reporting
   - Shift focus from commit counts to accomplishments
   - Effort weighting based on complexity
   - Activity vs output distinction

commits.subject: Add dynamic size constraints for layout sections and cells
commits.body:
- Add MIN_SIZE (10%) and MAX_SIZE (90%) constants
- Dynamic max based on number of items: 100 - (n-1) * 10
  - 2 items: max 90%
  - 3 items: max 80%
  - 4 items: max 70%
- Prevents any section/cell from going below 10%
- Update slider min/max to reflect dynamic constraints
- Show constraint range in slider labels for clarity

commits.body: Add Auto button to reset text alignment to cell default

commits.subject: Fix text alignment fallback by adding textAlign to defaultTextLayer
commits.body:
The defaultTextLayer was missing textAlign, which could cause issues
with the fallback chain when a text layer was missing or incomplete.
Now explicitly sets textAlign: null to ensure proper fallback behavior.

commits.subject: Add Auto button to reset text alignment to cell default
commits.body:
Previously, the only way to reset a per-element text alignment back to
the cell default was a small "×" button that was easy to miss. Now there
is a dedicated "Auto" button (first in the alignment options) with a
faded icon that clearly shows when cell default is being used.

commits.subject: Refactor UI to workflow-based tabs
commits.body:

to workflow-based tabs: Templates | Media | Content | Layout | Style

New components:
- CollapsibleSection.jsx - Reusable collapsible section
- TemplatesTab.jsx - Complete designs + layout-only presets
- MediaTab.jsx - Image/logo upload with filters
- ContentTab.jsx - Text editing with cell assignment
- LayoutTab.jsx - Structure + cell alignment
- StyleTab.jsx - Themes, fonts, overlay, spacing

This follows the refactor plan in docs/REFACTOR_PLAN.md

commits.subject: Fix multiline text display for all text elements

newlines into spaces. Now all text inputs properly display multiline

commits.subject: Merge pull request #26 from devmade-ai/claude/alignment-cell-vs-text-wH2ET
commits.body: Add per-text-element horizontal alignment

commits.subject: Make all text inputs multiline for flexibility
Add alignment controls to Text tab
commits.body:
Now users can set horizontal alignment from both:
- Text tab (alongside color, size, style, spacing)
- Layout > Placement tab (with cell context)

Both control the same state property (text[element].textAlign)

commits.subject: Add per-text-element horizontal alignment
commits.body:
Changes alignment from cell-level to text-level for horizontal alignment:
- Each text element (title, tagline, etc.) can now have its own textAlign
- Alignment fallback chain: element → cell → global
- Keeps vertical alignment at cell level (appropriate for layout positioning)

Use case: centered headline with left-aligned body text in same cell

Changes:
- useAdState.js: Add textAlign/textVerticalAlign to each text group
- AdCanvas.jsx: Apply per-element alignment via alignSelf + textAlign
- LayoutSelector.jsx: Add alignment buttons per text element in Placement tab
- CLAUDE.md: Document new alignment architecture

commits.subject: Merge pull request #25 from devmade-ai/claude/add-overlay-options-RdHFw
commits.body: Add expanded overlay options for better layout support

commits.subject: Enable overlay stacking: global + cell overlays layer together
commits.body:
- Global overlay (Image tab) always applies to image cells
- Cell overlay (Layout > Overlay) stacks on top as additional layer
- Allows combining effects like vignette + gradient for rich visuals
- getCellOverlay no longer falls back to global (handled separately)
- Fixed non-image cell check for enabled: false

commits.subject: Fix per-cell overlay not applying to image cells
commits.body:
The renderImage function was hardcoded to use the global overlay,
ignoring per-cell overlay settings. Now it accepts an overlay config
parameter that respects cell-level overrides for both:
- Multi-cell layouts (rows/columns with image cells)
- Fullbleed layouts (single cell 0)

commits.subject: Update CLAUDE.md with expanded overlay options

- Add spotlight effect (inverse vignette) for center-focused content
- Update overlay button labels with arrow icons for clarity
- Update grid layout to 4 columns for better fit with 12 overlay types
- Add contextual tips for all new overlay types

commits.body:
Security & Session Management:

- Password creation mandatory during first-time setup
- Activity timestamp persisted to localStorage (survives refresh)
- Session unlock verifies against PBKDF2 hash

New Browser Recovery:

- Fixes bug where new browser created new wallet silently

- Polling now starts in Auth.store.ts after isMPCReady is true

commits.subject: Fix undo/redo for add/remove row operations
commits.body:
addSection and removeSection were mutating existing objects instead of
creating new ones, corrupting the undo history. Now uses .map() with
spread operator to ensure immutability.

Also added high-priority TODO for text placement selector updates.

commits.subject: Revert per-group alignment to cell-level alignment
commits.body:
Per-group alignment caused text elements to overlap because each group
was rendered in its own absolutely positioned container. This change
reverts to cell-level alignment where all text groups in a cell share
a single alignment container, allowing text to flow naturally.

- Simplified textGroups state to only store cell assignment (no alignment)
- Removed per-group alignment controls from Placement tab
- Updated AdCanvas to render all groups in single container per cell

- Add/remove sections dynamically
- Toggle subdivisions per section (split button)
- Resize sections and subdivisions with sliders
- New "Grid" category with 4 preset layouts using nested cells
- Click-to-select image cell in visual preview

to type/structure/imageCell format.

commits.subject: feat: complete pricing calculator with all 5 models + remove legacy code
commits.body:
Pricing Calculator (Mode 1):
- Implemented all 5 pricing models with equilibrium analysis:
  * Subscription (SaaS): Monthly recurring revenue
  * Usage-Based: Pay per unit (API calls, transactions)
  * Per-Seat: Price per user/seat
  * One-Time: Perpetual license + maintenance
  * Marketplace: Commission-based model
- Each model shows equilibrium zone (minimum to maximum viable price)
- Displays suggested price, financial metrics, and ROI for both parties
- Reactive calculations with proper input validation

Legacy Cleanup:
- Deleted entire /legacy/ folder (1.3MB vanilla JS code)
- Updated CLAUDE.md to reflect new TypeScript + SvelteKit architecture
- Removed ~50 legacy files (models, calculators, UI components)

Both modes now complete in new architecture:
- Mode 1: Pricing Calculator (5 models)
- Mode 2: Transaction Structuring (6 models, 47 variants)
commits.title: complete pricing calculator with all 5 models + remove legacy code

commits.subject: feat: implement pricing calculator with subscription model
commits.body:
- Replaced placeholder with working pricing calculator
- Added model selector (5 models: subscription, usage-based, per-seat, one-time, marketplace)
- Implemented subscription model with equilibrium analysis
- Shows minimum price (seller needs), maximum price (buyer willing to pay), and suggested price
- Displays financial metrics, seller position, and client ROI
- Real-time reactive calculations as inputs change
- Subscription model fully functional, other 4 models to be added

The calculator helps find the price range where both seller hits margin AND buyer sees ROI.
commits.title: implement pricing calculator with subscription model

commits.subject: feat: architecture redesign - Phase 1 foundation
commits.body:
Migrate from vanilla JS to TypeScript + SvelteKit monorepo architecture
for improved maintainability, type safety, and testability.

Changes:
- Add monorepo structure with pnpm workspaces
- Create @model-pear/calculator package with TypeScript
  - Extract Model 1 (Cost-Plus) with full type definitions
  - Add comprehensive test suite (44 tests)
  - Define types for entities, results, and calculations
- Create @model-pear/web SvelteKit app shell
  - Set up Tailwind CSS configuration
  - Add landing page with mode selector
  - Add proof-of-concept UI for Model 1
  - Configure static adapter for GitHub Pages
- Move existing vanilla JS code to legacy/ folder
- Add ARCHITECTURE.md documenting the redesign

Build commands:
- pnpm install: Install dependencies
- pnpm test: Run calculator tests
- pnpm build: Build all packages

This is Phase 1 of 4 in the migration plan.
Next: Extract Models 2-6 and projection calculations.

was capturing the scaled-down version. Now temporarily sets scale(1) during
capture to export at correct dimensions.

undefined (can happen during hot reload). Skip font embedding in
html-to-image export to avoid cross-origin stylesheet errors with
Google Fonts.

commits.subject: Refactor testing to workflow-based logical assertions
commits.body:
Replace numerical math tests with readable workflow-based tests that verify
displayed values are logically correct based on user actions and inputs.

Changes:
- Create ASSERTIONS library with reusable logical checks
- Each assertion has: field name, readable logic formula, description
- Define WORKFLOW_SCENARIOS that read like user stories
- Tests now verify "Developer Revenue = Cost × (1 + Markup)" logic
- Not testing math (1000 × 1.1 = 1100), testing business logic
- Update UI to display stories, workflow badges, and assertion formulas

commits.subject: Improve test documentation with business rules and formulas
commits.body:
Each test case now includes:
- businessRule: Explains WHY the test exists (accounting/tax logic)
- formula: Step-by-step calculation showing HOW expected values derive
- source: Reference to documentation (CALCULATIONS.md, IAS 38, OECD, etc.)

The expanded test view in the UI now displays these fields with
appropriate formatting:
- Business Rule: Blue-tinted box explaining the accounting principle
- Formula: Monospace green text showing the calculation steps
- Source: Reference badge linking to standards/documentation

commits.subject: Add testing lab tab for validating calculation correctness
commits.body:
New feature that allows testing pre-populated input combinations against
expected outcomes to verify calculations are working correctly.

Features:
- Testing tab with "Run Tests" button to execute all tests at once
- Individual test execution with detailed pass/fail results
- Pre-defined test cases for Model 1 (all variants), Model 2, Model 3
- Edge case tests (zero cost, high margin, custom tax rates)
- Filter tests by model for focused testing
- Expandable test details showing inputs and expected vs actual values
- Summary panel with pass rate, duration, and error counts
- Custom test capture from current calculator state

  - savedComparisons array in state

commits.body:
Add new Options Overview landing view that shows all 6 transaction models
at a glance, addressing the gap where users had to pick a model before
seeing alternatives.

New features:
- Model cards grid with icon, summary, key features, best-for tags
- Quick comparison table for side-by-side model analysis

Technical changes:

- New options-overview.js component with responsive CSS grid
- Updated calculator.js with Overview mode integration

commits.subject: Implement Phase 1: Perspective Toggle Enhancement
commits.body:
This commit implements Phase 1 of the IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN, enhancing
the perspective toggle and party relationship selection experience.

New Features:
- Party Relationship Selector (party-selector.js): Prominent radio cards
  for selecting between "Independent Parties" (2 perspectives) and
  "Related Parties" (3 perspectives with Shareholder view)
- Enhanced Perspective Toggle: Dynamic labels that change based on
  relationship type - "Net Effect" becomes "Shareholder" when Related
- Keyboard shortcuts: D (Developer), B (Buyer), S (Shareholder/Net Effect),
  M (toggle Mutual Ownership)

Changes:
- Created ui/intercompany/party-selector.js
- Added setRelationshipType() and arePartiesRelated() to app-state.js
- Integrated party selector into calculator.js

commits.subject: Fix reserved keyword 'eval' in destructuring assignment
commits.body:
The compliance-analyzer.js was using 'eval' as a variable name in a
destructuring assignment, which is a reserved JavaScript keyword and
causes a SyntaxError. Renamed to 'evaluation'.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: Implement Phase 11: Range Selections & Sensitivity Analysis
commits.body:
Adds comprehensive sensitivity analysis capabilities:

- Range Input Framework (11.1):
  - Low/Base/High input mode with color-coded fields
  - Slider-based variance adjustment
  - Variance patterns (conservative/moderate/aggressive)
  - Support for cost, revenue, margin, duration inputs

- Sensitivity Calculations (11.2):
  - Best/Base/Worst case scenario calculations
  - Break-even analysis with margin of safety
  - Input sensitivity ranking by impact
  - Monte Carlo simulation with triangular distribution

- Sensitivity Visualizations (11.3):
  - Tornado chart showing input sensitivities
  - Fan chart for projection ranges
  - Break-even margin visualization
  - Monte Carlo histogram with percentiles

New files:
- models/intercompany/sensitivity-analysis.js
- ui/intercompany/range-input.js
- ui/intercompany/sensitivity-visualizations.js

Integrates into calculator UI with new Sensitivity tab.
commits.title: Implement Phase 11: Range Selections & Sensitivity Analysis

commits.subject: refactor: unify semantic status colors with jewel tone palette
commits.body:
Replace separate semantic status colors (green/red/amber) with jewel tones:
- Success/Positive → Accent (Emerald Teal #00BFA5)
- Error/Warning/Destructive → Secondary (Ruby Magenta #E91E63)
- Info/Neutral → Primary (Sapphire Blue #3D5AFE)

commits.subject: docs: update HISTORY.md with commit hash
commits.title: update HISTORY.md with commit hash

commits.subject: fix: correct border colors and destructive action colors throughout app
commits.body:
Problem:
- Borders throughout app used border-primary/XX (blue tint) instead of
  neutral gray border colors
- "End Chat" destructive action used bg-secondary (magenta) instead of
  semantic error (red)
- Error messages used bg-secondary/20 instead of bg-errorBg
- Chat background pattern at 4% opacity was too subtle to be visible

Solution:
- Replace all border-primary/XX, border-secondary/XX, border-accent/XX
  with neutral border (#404040) or borderDark (#505050)
- Change "End Chat" button from bg-secondary/90 to bg-error/90 (red)
- Change error message styling from secondary to error colors
- Increase chat background pattern opacity from 4% to 8%

Preserved intentional color usage:
- Reply bars: border-l-4 border-primary for visual accent
- Reaction badges: bg-primary border-primary when user has reacted
- Action buttons: bg-primary, bg-secondary, bg-accent for themed actions
- Link text: text-primary for clickable links
- Status badges: bg-secondary/30 for "Waiting..." indicators

Impact:
- Borders now appear as neutral dark gray instead of blue-tinted
- Destructive actions use red (error) color for clearer intent
- Error messages visually distinct with red backgrounds
- Chat background pattern more visible
- Theme accent colors reserved for intentional usage only
commits.title: correct border colors and destructive action colors throughout app
