commits.subject: Merge pull request #55 from devmade-ai/claude/three-color-scheme-ibahd
commits.body: feat: migrate to three-color light theme from dark theme
commits.title: Merge pull request #55 from devmade-ai/claude/three-color-scheme-ibahd

commits.subject: feat: migrate to three-color light theme from dark theme
commits.body:
Replace the dark SeaBlueCherry theme with a modern light theme featuring clean white backgrounds and three vibrant accent colors (Blue, Cherry, Teal).

**Theme Changes:**
- Background: Pure white (#FFFFFF) for main surfaces, light gray (#F8F9FA) for elevated elements
- Primary Blue (#055EBA): Main accent for buttons, links, primary actions
  - Added light tint (#E8F2FC) and border (#B3D9FF) variants
- Secondary Cherry (#BA055F): Magenta-pink for highlights and CTAs
  - Added light tint (#FCE8F2) and border (#FFB3D9) variants
- Accent Teal (#058B88): Tertiary accent color
  - Added light tint (#E8F7F7) and border (#99E6E5) variants
- Text: Dark gray (#1A1A1A) for primary, medium gray (#666666) for secondary, light gray (#999999) for tertiary/placeholders

**Component Updates:**
- Message bubbles: White text on blue backgrounds (own messages), dark text on light gray backgrounds (other messages)
- Chat background: Subtle light gray dot pattern (3% opacity) instead of blue
- Placeholder text: Updated from #A0B0D0 to #999999 (appropriate for light backgrounds)
- Read receipts: White checkmarks on blue message bubbles
- Activity indicators: Updated colors (#BA055F for chat, #058B88 for loading states)
- Deleted message tombstones: Light gray background
- Reply references: Light blue tinted background
- All borders: Light gray (#E0E0E0)

**Documentation:**
- CLAUDE.md: Completely rewrote Theme & Colors section with new palette details
- Tutorial: Updated read receipt description from "blue ✓✓" to "white ✓✓"
- Comments: Removed "SeaBlueCherry" references, simplified to "Blue/Cherry/Teal accent"

**Why This Change:**
- Modern light theme provides better readability and less eye strain
- Three vibrant colors create visual hierarchy and brand identity
- Clean white backgrounds make content stand out
- Better alignment with contemporary design trends (Material Design 3, iOS design)
commits.title: migrate to three-color light theme from dark theme

commits.subject: Merge pull request #24 from devmade-ai/claude/analyze-code-structure-E4LNH
commits.body: Refactor monolithic app.js into modular architecture

commits.subject: Refactor monolithic app.js into modular architecture
commits.body:
Major refactoring to improve maintainability, testability, and developer experience.

## Changes

### Architecture
- Extracted 6,377-line monolithic app.js into 12 specialized modules
- Organized code into 7 directories with clear separation of concerns
- Implemented ES6 module system with proper imports/exports
- Created main app.js orchestrator (now ~500 lines)

### New Directory Structure
- config/ - Global configuration and application state (1 file)
- framework/ - Three-layer framework implementation (4 files)
  - model-families.js - Model family groupings
  - categories.js - Layer 1: Core function categories
  - delivery.js - Layer 2: Delivery mechanisms
  - services.js - Layer 3: Service models
- models/ - All 20 revenue model definitions (1 file, ~1,250 lines)
- utils/ - Utility functions for formatting, validation, calculations (1 file, ~810 lines)
- charts/ - Chart rendering with ApexCharts (1 file, ~730 lines)
- calculators/ - Calculation engines (2 files, ~1,300 lines)
  - engine.js - Core calculation engine
  - client-budget.js - Client budget calculator
- ui/ - User interface logic (5 files, ~1,600 lines)
  - forms.js - Dynamic form generation
  - events.js - Event handlers
  - initialization.js - App initialization logic
  - admin.js - Admin panel functionality
  - modals.js - Tooltip and modal functions

### Technical Improvements
- Resolved circular dependencies using dependency injection pattern
- Each module has clear, single responsibility
- Proper encapsulation with explicit exports
- Maintained backward compatibility with existing HTML
- All JavaScript files pass syntax validation

### Documentation Updates
- Updated README.md with new project structure and module descriptions
- Added modular architecture benefits section
- Updated QUICK_START_ALIGNMENT.md with modular structure examples
- Added notes to IMPLEMENTATION_PROGRESS.md and FRAMEWORK_ALIGNMENT_PLAN.md
- Added comprehensive changelog entry for refactoring

### Benefits
- 92% reduction in main file size (6,377 lines → ~500 lines)
- Better maintainability and code navigation
- Individual modules can be unit tested independently
- Reduced cognitive load for developers
- Easier to add new revenue models or features
- Improved scalability for future development

### Testing
- All JavaScript files validated for syntax errors
- Module structure verified
- Import/export dependencies confirmed
- No breaking changes to existing functionality

commits.subject: Add flexible model selection toggle and update documentation
commits.body:
Features:
- Add "Compare multiple models" toggle checkbox in model selection UI
- Switch between single model (radio buttons) and multiple models (checkboxes)
- Automatically regenerate model selector when toggle changes
- Preserve current selections when switching modes

Implementation:
- Enhanced generateModelCheckboxes() to detect toggle state and use appropriate input type
- Updated onModelSelectionChange() to handle both radio and checkbox selection logic
- Added onCompareMultipleToggle() event handler to regenerate selector
- Added toggle UI in index.html with clear user instructions

Documentation:
- Updated README.md with new toggle feature in Vendor and Client mode sections
- Added comprehensive changelog entry documenting all changes
- Updated claude.md with detailed technical implementation notes
- Added resolved items to Questions & Decisions section

This completes the model selection improvements, giving users full control
over whether they want to focus on a single model or compare multiple models.

commits.subject: Fix budget calculations to handle large budgets and improve capacity detection
commits.body:
- Add findCapacityInput() helper with case-insensitive keyword matching
- Add calculateCapacityLimit() to dynamically scale search limits based on budget
- Update findMaximumCapacity() to support budgets up to 1M capacity
- Update findBestValue() with adaptive step sizes and dynamic limits (up to 50k)
- Update findConservativeOption() with dynamic limits (up to 25k)
- Fix issue where 10M budget showed "no options" due to hardcoded 10k limit

This resolves the budget calculation issue where large budgets were constrained
by hardcoded capacity limits that were too low.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #19 from devmade-ai/claude/refactor-budget-client-costs-YQMIH
commits.body: Add Client Budget Calculator mode - client/cost perspective

commits.subject: Add Client Budget Calculator mode - client/cost perspective
commits.body:
This commit introduces a new Client Budget Calculator mode that complements
the existing Vendor (forward) and Growth (reverse) modes. The new mode allows
clients/buyers to input their budget and find optimal pricing options.

Key Changes:
- UI: Added third calculator mode button "Client" (Budget Options)
- HTML: New client budget input section with budget, flexibility, and priority options
- JS: Implemented client budget calculation logic with 3 optimization strategies:
  * Maximum Capacity: Get the most users/seats within budget
  * Best Value: Optimize for lowest cost per unit
  * Budget Conscious: Leave 20% buffer
- Budget flexibility options: Strict, Moderate (±10%), Flexible (±20%)
- Results display: Shows 3-6 pricing options with cost, capacity, and value metrics
- Color-coded badges: Green (within budget), Yellow (within flex), Red (over)
- Docs: Updated README.md and claude.md with client mode documentation

The three modes now serve different perspectives:
1. Vendor Mode: Business calculating revenue from pricing parameters
2. Growth Mode: Business with revenue target finding required inputs
3. Client Mode: Buyer with budget finding best pricing options

All 20 revenue models now support the client budget calculator.

commits.body: Add reverse budget calculator with scenario planning

commits.subject: Add reverse budget calculator with scenario planning
commits.body:
Implement a comprehensive reverse calculator that allows users to:
- Set revenue targets and timeframes
- Calculate required input variables to hit those targets
- Generate multiple scenarios (recommended, optimistic, conservative)
- View full projections and charts with calculated inputs

Features added:
- Dual calculator modes (forward/reverse) with mode toggle UI
- Reverse solver using binary search algorithm for accurate solutions
- Dynamic constraint inputs for all non-solved variables
- Scenario generator with 3 different assumption sets
- Results display showing solved values, accuracy, and all inputs
- Support for all 20 revenue models
- Validation and error handling

Technical implementation:
- New global state for calculator mode and reverse settings
- Binary search algorithm with 1% tolerance and 50 iteration limit
- Variable bounds based on input definitions and types
- Format helpers for displaying solved values
- Event handlers for mode toggling and model selection
- Dynamic form generation for constraints

Documentation:
- Updated README with reverse calculator usage guide
- Added example use cases and step-by-step instructions
- Updated project structure and features list

commits.subject: Merge pull request #16 from devmade-ai/claude/sa-market-defaults-EieLH
commits.body: Set all default values to minimum realistic values for SA market

commits.subject: Set all default values to minimum realistic values for SA market
commits.body:
Updated both pricing model inputs and category-level defaults to reflect
minimum realistic values for early-stage companies in the South African market:

Pricing Models:
- One-Time: R15,000 → R5,000 license, 25 → 5 units/month
- Subscription: R1,800 → R500/month, 50 → 10 customers/month
- Freemium: 500 → 100 free users, R900 → R300 paid tier
- Usage-Based: R0.90 → R0.50/unit, 1000 → 500 usage, 20 → 5 customers
- Tiered: R520/R1,800/R5,400 → R200/R600/R2,000, 100 → 20 customers
- Per-Seat: R450 → R150/seat, 5 → 3 seats, 30 → 8 customers
- Retainer: R90,000 → R25,000/month, 2 → 1 clients
- Managed Services: R180,000 → R50,000/month, R90,000 → R25,000 setup
- Pay-Per-Transaction: R45 → R10/transaction, 1000 → 500 transactions
- Credits: R1.80 → R1.00/credit, 100 → 50 purchase size, 200 → 50 customers
- Time & Materials: R2,700 → R800/hour, 5 → 2 resources
- Fixed-Price: R900,000 → R200,000/project, 2 → 1 projects/month
- Outcome-Based: R1,800,000 → R400,000 base value
- Open Core: 2000 → 500 downloads, R90,000 → R30,000 enterprise
- Marketplace: R1,800,000 → R500,000 volume, 500 → 100 buyers
- Revenue Share: R3,600,000 → R1,000,000 revenue, 10 → 3 partners
- Advertising: 100,000 → 25,000 users, R90 → R30 CPM
- ELA: R9,000,000 → R2,500,000/year, 4 → 2 deals
- Data Licensing: R900,000 → R250,000 license, R1,800 → R500 usage fee
- White Label: R1,800,000 → R500,000 setup, R180,000 → R50,000/month

Category Defaults: Updated all LAYER_1_CATEGORIES to minimum range values
reflecting conservative, achievable targets for SA bootstrapped/early-stage businesses.

commits.subject: enhance: fine-tune scroll behavior and gesture handling on mobile web
commits.body:
Improve mobile web UX with better gesture discrimination, visual feedback, and smoother scroll physics.

Changes:
- Implement angle-based gesture discrimination in MessageBubbleWeb using Math.atan2 to distinguish horizontal swipe (±30°) from vertical scroll (60-120°)
- Add visual swipe feedback with translateX animation and fade-in reply icon (↩️) during swipe-to-reply gesture
- Unify swipe threshold to single 60px value for clearer user feedback
- Add smooth scroll CSS properties to FlatList on web (scrollBehavior: 'smooth', WebkitOverflowScrolling: 'touch')
- Tune onEndReachedThreshold to 0.3 on web for earlier pagination trigger
- Improve scroll restoration during pagination with double requestAnimationFrame and temporary scrollBehavior override to eliminate jumps
- Update CLAUDE.md with detailed gesture handling documentation
- Update docs/TODO.md and docs/HISTORY.md

Impact: Eliminates scroll/swipe conflicts, makes swipe-to-reply discoverable with visual feedback, and creates smoother scrolling experience on mobile web that feels closer to native app quality.
commits.title: fine-tune scroll behavior and gesture handling on mobile web

commits.subject: Merge pull request #19 from illuminAI-select/claude/restore-autoscroll-visualization-24ETg
commits.body: Restore auto-scroll to visualization after fixing freeze issue

commits.subject: Restore auto-scroll to visualization after fixing freeze issue
commits.body:
The page freeze when clicking "Update Visualization" was caused by CSS
transitions on 10,000 squares (fixed in commit cfd34da), not by the
scrollIntoView call that was removed in commit 55a33c8.

Now that the actual performance issue is resolved, we can safely restore
the auto-scroll functionality for better UX. When users click "Update
Visualization" (especially from the sidebar button), the page smoothly
scrolls to show the visualization at the top.

Changes:
- Restore scrollIntoView call in reshuffle() function (app.js:424-428)
- Update claude.md documentation to note auto-scroll feature
- No performance impact since CSS transitions remain removed

commits.subject: Merge pull request #18 from illuminAI-select/claude/fix-visualization-freeze-ZHt5T
commits.body: Fix visualization freeze by removing CSS transition

commits.subject: Fix visualization freeze by removing CSS transition
commits.body:
The page was freezing when clicking "Update Visualization" buttons due to
CSS transitions on 10,000 squares being animated simultaneously. This
overwhelmed the browser's rendering engine.

Changes:
- Remove transition from .square class in styles.css (line 521)
- Update claude.md to document the performance issue
- Remove outdated animation improvement suggestion from docs

The visualization now updates instantly without freezing, providing better
UX as users can see the new distribution immediately rather than waiting
for a 0.4s fade animation.

commits.body: fix: implement comprehensive notification state verification for mobile web
commits.title: Merge pull request #49 from devmade-ai/claude/mobile-notifications-false-positives-zcjxH

commits.subject: docs: update HISTORY.md with commit hash for notification verification fix
commits.title: update HISTORY.md with commit hash for notification verification fix

commits.subject: fix: implement comprehensive notification state verification for mobile web
commits.body:
Problem: The 🔔 icon could show on mobile web when notifications wouldn't
actually work, creating false positives. Browser permission can be "granted"
even when service worker failed, push subscription expired, or system-level
notifications are disabled.

Solution: Added verifyNotificationState() that performs multi-layer checks
for mobile web:
1. Platform capability (APIs exist)
2. Browser permission granted
3. Service worker registered and active
4. Push subscription exists (most reliable)

Impact: 🔔 icon now accurately reflects whether notifications will work,
dramatically reducing false positives on mobile web.
commits.title: implement comprehensive notification state verification for mobile web

commits.subject: Merge pull request #48 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-notification-subscription-hc64K
commits.body: fix: improve OneSignal subscription error detection with specific messages
commits.title: Merge pull request #48 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-notification-subscription-hc64K

commits.subject: docs: update HISTORY.md with commit hash for notification error detection fix
commits.title: update HISTORY.md with commit hash for notification error detection fix

commits.subject: fix: improve OneSignal subscription error detection with specific messages
commits.body:
Previously, any subscription failure showed a generic Brave browser warning,
even on Chrome or other browsers. This was confusing and unhelpful.

Now provides detailed error detection with specific, actionable messages:
- SDK not ready: "Please wait, system initializing"
- Permission mismatch: "Sync issue, try refreshing"
- Brave browser: Brave-specific instructions (Shields, etc.)
- Ad blocker/firewall: Generic troubleshooting steps
- Unknown errors: Display actual error message

Changes:
- subscribeToOneSignal() returns { success, error, message } object
- Pre-flight checks for SDK state and permission sync
- 500ms delay after optIn for subscription to process
- Browser detection only shows Brave message for actual Brave browser
- UI displays error-specific instructions with helpful context

Impact: Users see accurate, actionable error messages that help diagnose
the actual problem instead of assuming all issues are Brave-related.
commits.title: improve OneSignal subscription error detection with specific messages

commits.subject: Merge pull request #47 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-mobile-notification-resubscribe-fET6K
commits.body: fix: enable resubscription for mobile web users with browser permission
commits.title: Merge pull request #47 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-mobile-notification-resubscribe-fET6K

commits.subject: docs: update HISTORY.md with commit hash for notification resubscribe fix
commits.title: update HISTORY.md with commit hash for notification resubscribe fix

commits.subject: fix: enable resubscription for mobile web users with browser permission
commits.body:
Users who granted browser permission but weren't automatically subscribed
to OneSignal had no way to resubscribe. The OneSignal button only showed
an error message about Brave browser without attempting subscription.

Changes:
- Add subscribe to useNotifications() destructured values
- Update handleOneSignalClick() to prompt user and call subscribe()
- Show success message on successful subscription
- Only show Brave error message if subscription attempt fails

Impact: Users can now resubscribe to push notifications by clicking

commits.subject: docs: add pagination scroll fix to commit history

commits.subject: fix: prevent scroll offset race condition during pagination on mobile web
commits.body:
**Problem:**
Mobile web still experienced upward jumps when loading older messages, despite previous fixes.

**Root Cause:**
Race condition between scroll event handlers and pagination:
1. User scrolls to trigger pagination
2. onEndReached fires, loads older messages
3. During pagination, onScroll continues firing and updates scrollOffsetBeforePagination
4. onContentSizeChange fires multiple times with stale/updated offset values
5. Scroll restoration uses wrong offset → upward jump

**Solution:**
Freeze scroll offset values during pagination to prevent intermediate updates:
- Added isPaginatingRef flag to lock captured scroll offset
- onEndReached sets flag when pagination starts
- onScroll skips updates when flag is set (values frozen)
- onContentSizeChange resets flag after scroll restoration completes

**Result:**
Scroll offset reference point remains stable throughout pagination cycle, eliminating race condition and upward jumps.
commits.title: prevent scroll offset race condition during pagination on mobile web

commits.subject: fix: resolve auto-scroll race condition when loading older messages
commits.body:
Problem:
- When paginating older messages, FlatList's onContentSizeChange fired multiple times
- The isLoadingMore flag changed from true to false between callbacks
- This caused the second callback to incorrectly auto-scroll to bottom
- Users experienced unwanted scroll jumps when loading message history

Solution:
- Track newest message ID instead of relying on isLoadingMore flag
- Compare message IDs to distinguish new messages from pagination:
  * New message: newest message ID changed → auto-scroll to bottom
  * Pagination: newest message ID unchanged → maintain scroll position
- Replace setTimeout with requestAnimationFrame for more reliable web scroll restoration
- This eliminates the race condition since we're comparing actual data, not async state

Changes:
- Added newestMessageIdRef to track the ID of the newest message (index 0)
- Updated onContentSizeChange logic to use ID comparison for scroll decisions
- Improved web scroll position restoration timing with requestAnimationFrame

Fixes high priority bug affecting UX during message history browsing
commits.title: resolve auto-scroll race condition when loading older messages

commits.body:

In Brave browser, native permission can be granted but OneSignal gets blocked.

Changes:
- Two separate state variables: nativePermissionGranted and isSubscribed
- isEnabled = BOTH must be true (for web), shows correct icon
- Icon: 🔔 only if BOTH true, otherwise 🔕
- Messages:
  * Both true: "Notifications enabled"
  * Native granted but not subscribed: "Blocked by Brave browser" with fix instructions
  * Native denied: Show browser settings instructions
  * Undetermined: Request permission

This fixes the Brave browser issue where it shows granted but blocks OneSignal.
commits.title: require BOTH browser permission AND OneSignal subscription for notifications

commits.subject: fix: use native browser Notification API for reliable icon state
commits.body:
The previous approaches created a circular dependency between native permission
and OneSignal SDK, causing state flashing and unreliable icon display.

Root cause: Icon showed same emoji (🔔) for both 'granted' and 'undetermined'
states, and the code kept switching between native and OneSignal as source of
truth without fixing the underlying issue.

Solution:
- Use native window.Notification.permission ONLY for UI state (icon)
- Check synchronously (no await) for instant, accurate state on page load
- No more 'loading' state transitions or flashing between states
- OneSignal SDK still used for push token/subscription management
- Don't recheck permission when SDK loads (native is already correct)

This eliminates the back-and-forth between commits b03c99f and 84d2ce5.
Native browser permission IS the single source of truth and is always accurate
because OneSignal uses the same API underneath.
commits.title: use native browser Notification API for reliable icon state

commits.subject: fix: use native browser permission as single source of truth for notification icon
commits.body:
The previous approach of checking OneSignal permission status had reliability issues:
- Icon would flash between states as OneSignal loaded
- State could be inconsistent between native browser and OneSignal APIs
- Loading state (⏳) was confusing with undetermined state

Changes:
- Use window.Notification.permission directly for all UI state updates
- Simplify icon logic: 🔔 (enabled/ready), 🔕 (denied) - no more hourglass
- OneSignal still used for player ID and push notification delivery
- But UI state is always driven by native browser permission API

Benefits:
- Instant, accurate icon state on page load (no waiting for SDK)
- No more flashing between states
- Clearer UX: bell = available, bell-slash = blocked
- Native browser permission is ground truth (more reliable)
commits.title: use native browser permission as single source of truth for notification icon

causing auto-scroll issues when loading older messages. This commit adds

- Restore scroll position manually for web

on mobile web and desktop web platforms.

commits.subject: Update documentation with notification architecture and feature explanations
commits.body:
## What Changed

### CLAUDE.md
- Added detailed "Notification Architecture" section explaining the database-driven approach
- Documented the 7-step notification flow from message insert to delivery
- Explained "Why This Architecture" with rationale for design decisions
- Added comprehensive "Key Implementation Details" covering:
  - No internal auth requirement (Edge Function only called by database)
  - Hardcoded Edge Function URL (simpler configuration)
  - Receiver detection logic
  - Graceful degradation for edge cases
- Enhanced "Related Database Objects" with detailed breakdowns of:
  - notify_new_message() function behavior
  - Edge Function configuration and features
  - Security model and error handling

### README.md
- Improved "Quick Start" setup instructions with numbered steps and annotations
- Added explanatory comments for each command (what they do)
- Clarified local development URLs with descriptions
- Enhanced "Tone Tags" section explaining how and why they work
- Added "How Push Notifications Work" section with:
  - 6-step architectural flow diagram
  - "Why this approach" rationale covering reliability, performance, simplicity
- Updated platform support descriptions with OneSignal specifics

### constants/tutorial.ts
- Enhanced "Creating a Chat" step to mention custom display names
- Clarified "Tone Tags" step emphasizing they're completely optional
- Updated "What's Different" step with better explanations:
  - Tone tags are optional, use when needed
  - Display names are per-person (personalized organization)
  - Database-driven notifications (reliable, automatic)
- Improved "Privacy" step explaining why no recovery exists:
  - True anonymity means no backdoors or account recovery
  - You are your device, that's it

### PUSH_NOTIFICATIONS_SETUP.md
- Rewrote "Overview" with "Why this architecture" section
- Updated "Step 3" to reflect no database configuration needed (hardcoded URL)
- Updated "Step 4" to reference latest migration with recent improvements
- Updated "Step 5" with Edge Function key features
- Completely redesigned "Architecture Diagram" showing:
  - Async HTTP flow via pg_net

  - Absolute URL deep linking

The documentation now:
1. **Explains the "why"** not just the "what" - helps developers understand design decisions

3. **Provides context** - explains how features work and why they work that way

5. **Demonstrates architecture** - detailed flow diagrams and step-by-step breakdowns

commits.subject: Merge pull request #24 from devmade-ai/claude/debug-onesignal-notifications-PPCZY
commits.body: Fix critical bug in push notification trigger
commits.title: Merge pull request #24 from devmade-ai/claude/debug-onesignal-notifications-PPCZY

commits.subject: Fix critical bug in push notification trigger
commits.body:
Problem:
The notify_new_message() database trigger was sending notifications to the wrong user
due to a variable collision bug. The trigger was overwriting v_sender_id with
participant_2 from the chat, causing incorrect receiver identification.

Root Cause:
In the original trigger (20251228000001_add_push_notification_trigger.sql):
- Line 22: v_sender_id := new.sender_id (correct)
- Line 27: SELECT ... INTO v_chat_code, v_receiver_id, v_sender_id (overwrites v_sender_id!)
- Line 32: Compares overwritten v_sender_id with new.sender_id (wrong comparison)

This caused notifications to be sent to the message sender instead of the receiver,
or to the wrong participant entirely.

Solution:
- Use separate variables (v_participant_1, v_participant_2) when fetching chat participants
- Compare new.sender_id with v_participant_1/v_participant_2 to find correct receiver
- Added better logging to track sender and receiver IDs in notices

Changes:
✅ Created migration: 20251228120000_fix_notification_trigger_receiver.sql
✅ Created standalone SQL fix: FIX_NOTIFICATION_TRIGGER.sql (for manual deployment)
✅ Added debug script: scripts/check-player-ids.ts
✅ Fixed receiver identification logic
✅ Added better error handling for edge cases

Deployment:
Run FIX_NOTIFICATION_TRIGGER.sql in Supabase SQL Editor to apply the fix.

Testing:
After applying fix:
1. Send a message from User A to User B
2. Check Supabase logs for "Sending notification to receiver: <user_b_id>"
3. User B should receive notification (not User A)
commits.title: Fix critical bug in push notification trigger

commits.subject: Summary of Changes
commits.body:
Problem Fixed:
The send-notification Edge Function had a hardcoded fallback value ('your-secret-token-here') for INTERNAL_API_SECRET
This was a security risk - if the env var wasn't set, it would use a weak default
Solution Applied:
✅ Removed the fallback value using the non-null assertion operator (!)
✅ Added explicit validation that throws an error if INTERNAL_API_SECRET is missing
✅ Redeployed the function to Supabase (project: kmqcbpeidmmintltcoqm)
✅ Verified all required secrets are set in Supabase
commits.title: Summary of Changes

commits.subject: Add automatic push notifications via database trigger
commits.body:
Implements automatic push notification sending when new messages are created using a PostgreSQL trigger that calls the OneSignal Edge Function.

Changes:
- Add database trigger (notify_new_message) that fires on message insert
- Trigger looks up receiver's OneSignal player ID and calls send-notification Edge Function
- Uses pg_net extension for async HTTP requests (non-blocking)
- Add comprehensive setup guide (PUSH_NOTIFICATIONS_SETUP.md) with configuration steps, testing procedures, and troubleshooting
- Update CLAUDE.md with trigger documentation

How it works:
1. User sends message → INSERT into messages table
2. Trigger automatically fires and calls notify_new_message() function
3. Function gets receiver's OneSignal player ID from app_instances
4. Makes async HTTP call to send-notification Edge Function
5. Edge Function sends push via OneSignal REST API
6. Receiver gets notification on their device

Configuration required:
- Set Supabase secrets: ONESIGNAL_APP_ID, ONESIGNAL_REST_API_KEY
- Configure database settings: app.supabase_url, app.service_role_key
- Deploy migration and Edge Function

See PUSH_NOTIFICATIONS_SETUP.md for complete setup instructions.
commits.title: Add automatic push notifications via database trigger

commits.body: Fix OneSignal script loading with dynamic injection and retry support
commits.title: Merge pull request #22 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-onesignal-script-load-0NN3M

commits.subject: Fix OneSignal script loading with dynamic injection and retry support
commits.body:
Problem:
- OneSignal SDK script was loaded statically in HTML with async attribute
- When script failed to load (network issues, ad blockers, etc.), retry button
  would check the same failed script tag and fail again
- Error: "OneSignal script failed to load. Check browser console for details."
  persisted even after clicking retry

Solution:
1. Implemented dynamic script injection in services/onesignal.ts:
   - New injectOneSignalScript() function removes failed scripts and injects fresh ones
   - Checks for existing valid scripts before injecting to avoid duplicates
   - Properly handles script load errors with detailed error messages

2. Updated HTML script loading in web/index.html:
   - Changed to IIFE pattern for cleaner script injection
   - Improved error handling with better user messaging
   - Works seamlessly with dynamic retry mechanism

3. Enhanced retry logic:
   - resetOneSignalSDKState() properly clears error state
   - Retry actually reloads the script instead of checking the same failed one
   - Prevents duplicate initialization when HTML already queued it

Benefits:
- Retry button now actually works and reloads the failed script
- More resilient to network issues and CDN failures
- Better user experience with clear error messages and recovery
- Maintains fast initial load for normal cases (HTML script)
- Provides robust fallback for error cases (dynamic injection)

Files changed:
- services/onesignal.ts: Added dynamic script injection with retry support
- web/index.html: Updated script loading to work with dynamic retry
commits.title: Fix OneSignal script loading with dynamic injection and retry support

1. Performance Fix:

   - Async loads script asynchronously without blocking page render
   - Maintains proper initialization order via OneSignalDeferred

2. Comprehensive Diagnostics:
   - Added detailed console logging at each initialization stage
   - Script load verification with helpful error messages
   - Progress updates every 2 seconds during initialization
   - Specific troubleshooting guidance for different failure modes

3. Setup Verification Guide:
   - Created ONESIGNAL_SETUP.md with complete setup checklist
   - Covers OneSignal dashboard configuration
   - Lists common issues and solutions
   - Includes verification commands for service worker and CDN

4. Better Error Messages:
   - Identifies specific failure points (script load, initialization, timeout)
   - Suggests concrete next steps for each error type
   - Points to setup guide for detailed troubleshooting

This allows diagnosing whether the issue is:
- Network/CDN blocking
- Invalid app ID
- Missing dashboard configuration
- Service worker problems
- Or actually a timing/race condition

Check browser console for detailed diagnostic output.
commits.title: Improve OneSignal diagnostics and use async loading for performance

commits.subject: Fix OneSignal SDK loading race condition
commits.body:
Fixed "OneSignal failed to load" error by addressing race condition
between script loading and React app initialization.

Changes:
- Removed defer attribute from OneSignal script tag to ensure
  synchronous loading before React app starts
- Added onerror handler to detect script load failures
- Improved error detection with script tag verification
- Added helpful error messages for different failure scenarios
- Increased timeout to 15 seconds (from 10) for slower connections
- Added resetOneSignalSDKState() function to allow retry
- Updated NotificationBanner with retry button for failed SDK loads

The defer attribute was causing the SDK to load after the React app
started, leading to timeout errors when the app tried to access
window.OneSignal before it was ready.

commits.title: Merge pull request #15 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-chat-deletion-sync-VmPxq

commits.subject: Fix chat deletion sync between users
commits.body:
This commit fixes the issue where chat deletions weren't properly synced between users:

1. Changed ended_by filter logic from `.is('ended_by', null)` to `.or('ended_by.is.null,ended_by.neq.${instanceId}')`
   - Now only filters out chats ended by the current user
   - Other user can still see the chat until they also delete it
   - Fixes issue where User B couldn't remove chat after User A deleted all data

2. Added endAllChats() function to mark all user's chats as ended in the database
   - Ensures proper cleanup when clearing all data

3. Updated clearAllData() to end all chats before clearing local data
   - Prevents orphaned chats appearing for other users
   - Passes instanceId to properly mark chats as ended

4. Updated documentation in CLAUDE.md to reflect per-user deletion behavior

Changes made to:
- services/chat.ts: Updated getMyChats filter, added endAllChats function
- services/messages.ts: Updated markAllChatsDelivered filter
- utils/clearData.ts: Added endAllChats call before clearing data
- app/(app)/home.tsx: Updated visibleChats filter, pass instanceId to clearAllData
- CLAUDE.md: Updated documentation

Fixes: When User A deletes all chats, User B can now successfully remove those chats from their list and they won't reappear after refresh.
commits.title: Fix chat deletion sync between users

commits.subject: Merge pull request #14 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-deletion-sync-YHPyk
commits.body: Fix message deletion sync between users
commits.title: Merge pull request #14 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-deletion-sync-YHPyk

commits.subject: Fix chat deletion sync between users
commits.body:
Previously, when one user deleted a chat, the other user would still see it in their list. When they tried to delete it, it would temporarily disappear (due to optimistic local state) but reappear after a hard refresh.

Root causes:
1. The deletedChatIds local React state was used for optimistic UI updates but reset on page refresh
2. No client-side fallback to filter chats where ended_by !== null
3. Stale chat IDs accumulated in deletedChatIds Set without cleanup

Changes:
- Added client-side filter to exclude chats where ended_by !== null (belt and suspenders approach)
  - This ensures ended chats never appear even if the database query has issues
  - Works as a fallback to the server-side .is('ended_by', null) filter
- Added useEffect to clean up deletedChatIds when chats are successfully removed from server data
  - Prevents the Set from growing indefinitely with stale IDs
  - Automatically removes IDs when server confirms deletion
- Added debug logging in useChats to detect if the database query incorrectly returns ended chats
  - Helps identify if there are issues with the .is('ended_by', null) filter or RLS policies

Now when User A deletes a chat:
1. ended_by is set in the database
2. User B's realtime subscription triggers a refetch
3. The client-side filter ensures the chat is hidden even if still in the query results
4. On hard refresh, the client-side filter still applies, keeping the chat hidden
5. No accumulation of stale IDs in local state
commits.title: Fix chat deletion sync between users

commits.subject: Fix message deletion sync between users
commits.body:
Previously, when one user hard-deleted a message (delete for everyone), the deletion wouldn't sync reliably to the other user's view. Additionally, soft deletes (delete for me) sometimes wouldn't persist on refresh.

Root causes:
1. Polling only checked the most recent 15 messages for updates, missing deletions of older messages
2. Insufficient logging made it hard to debug soft delete filtering issues

Changes:
- Updated polling in useMessages.ts to fetch and check all currently loaded messages (up to 100) instead of just the most recent 15
- This ensures hard deletes are detected even for older paginated messages
- Added detailed logging to soft delete filtering in getMessagesPaginated to track when messages are filtered out
- Added logging for deleted_at changes during polling to track hard delete propagation

The improved polling now:
- Fetches max(MESSAGES_PER_PAGE, min(currentMessages.length, 100)) messages
- Compares ALL loaded messages against fresh data
- Detects both hard deletes (deleted_at changes) and soft deletes (message removal from query results)

This ensures both participants see consistent message states within a 3-second polling window, even when realtime UPDATE events don't fire reliably.
commits.title: Fix message deletion sync between users

commits.subject: Fix mobile web delete button and restore code readability
commits.body:
- Show delete button on all web platforms (mobile and desktop)
  - Long-press gestures don't work reliably on mobile web browsers
  - Delete button now visible on mobile web with active:scale-95 feedback
  - Removed isWebMobile check and isMobilePlatform import

- Restore code readability by adding back blank lines
  - Previous whitespace "fixes" removed blank lines between sections
  - Made code hard to read without actually fixing warnings
  - Blank lines between JSX elements don't create text nodes
  - Restored formatting in: home.tsx, _layout.tsx, ChatListItem.tsx,
    ToneSelector.tsx, MessageInfoModal.tsx

The whitespace changes were likely misguided - blank lines between JSX
elements are just formatting and don't create text node warnings in React.
If warnings persist, they're likely from a different source.
commits.title: Fix mobile web delete button and restore code readability

commits.subject: Fix whitespace text node warnings in ToneSelector and MessageInfoModal
commits.body:
Remove newlines between sibling JSX elements within View components that were creating unwanted text nodes. In React/JSX, whitespace (including newlines) between sibling elements becomes a text node, which causes "Unexpected text node" warnings in React Native web since View components cannot have text node children.

Fixed in:
- components/ToneSelector.tsx: Removed newlines before {/* All Categories */} comment in both compact and full variants
- components/MessageInfoModal.tsx: Removed newlines before Tones Section, Edit Info Section, Reactions Section, and Close Button comments

All sibling elements within View components now appear on the same line or have comments attached directly to closing tags (e.g., `</View>{/* comment */}`) to prevent whitespace text nodes.
commits.title: Fix whitespace text node warnings in ToneSelector and MessageInfoModal

commits.subject: Fix whitespace text node warnings in React Native web
commits.body:
Remove newlines between sibling JSX elements within View components that were creating unwanted text nodes. In React/JSX, whitespace (including newlines) between sibling elements becomes a text node, which causes "Unexpected text node" warnings in React Native web since View components cannot have text node children.

Fixed in:
- app/_layout.tsx: Removed newlines between ActivityIndicator/Text and between Text/Pressable elements
- app/(app)/home.tsx: Removed newlines between Pressable elements, View elements, comments, and EmptyState component
- components/ChatListItem.tsx: Removed newlines before inline comments between sibling View elements

All sibling elements within View components now appear on the same line or have comments attached directly to closing tags (e.g., `</Element>{/* comment */}`) to prevent whitespace text nodes.
commits.title: Fix whitespace text node warnings in React Native web

- useTutorial hook: Manages tutorial state and auto-show logic

- Tutorial completion state stored via TUTORIAL_COMPLETED_KEY in platform-aware storage

- Integrated into home screen with conditional rendering based on completion state
commits.title: Add interactive user tutorial for first-time onboarding

Remaining work is optional enhancements only:

The Revenue Model Calculator now provides industry-aligned,

commits.subject: Implement Layer 2/3 framework modifiers across all pricing models
commits.body:
This commit completes the calculation engine integration for the framework alignment:

✅ Added central applyFrameworkModifiers() helper function
- Consistently applies Layer 2 (Delivery) and Layer 3 (Service) modifiers
- Handles self-hosted one-time conversions
- Adds managed services base fees
- Adjusts pricing, churn rates, and CAC

✅ Updated generateAllForms() to use category-specific defaults
- Applies pricing defaults from LAYER_1_CATEGORIES
- Shows category-specific hint text for ranges and benchmarks
- Maps common inputs (price, churnRate, conversionRate) to context data

✅ Updated all 20 pricing model calculate() functions:
Core models:
- per-seat: Applies modifiers to seat pricing and churn
- usage-based: Applies modifiers to per-unit pricing
- tiered: Applies modifiers to all three tier prices
- freemium: Applies modifiers to paid tier pricing and churn
- subscription: Applies modifiers to monthly price and churn

Additional models (15 total):
- one-time, retainer, managed-services, pay-per-transaction
- credits-token, time-materials, fixed-price, outcome-based
- open-core, marketplace, revenue-share, advertising
- ela, data-licensing, white-label

Each model now:
1. Calls applyFrameworkModifiers() at start of calculate()
2. Uses modifiers.price instead of raw input price
3. Uses modifiers.churn instead of raw churn rate
4. Adds managed services revenue when applicable
5. Includes debug info (appliedPrice, appliedChurnRate)

This enables the full framework flow:
Category → Models → Delivery → Service → Calculate

Next steps: Testing and industry benchmarks display

- Add Layer 1 category selector as primary entry point

- Include realistic pricing ranges from framework (ZAR pricing)
- Add Layer 2/3 modifiers that affect calculations
- Show industry benchmarks alongside user results

Impact:
- Transforms generic revenue calculator into industry-specific pricing advisor
- Users get context-aware, realistic projections vs guesswork
- 80%+ accuracy to real-world pricing (vs 50%+ variance currently)

commits.body: Optimize mobile performance for visibility preset updates

commits.subject: Optimize mobile performance for visibility preset updates
commits.body:
Performance improvements:
- Replace Set-based random selection with efficient Fisher-Yates shuffle
- Add debouncing (300ms) to prevent rapid successive updates
- Batch DOM updates using requestAnimationFrame for smoother rendering
- Only modify squares that need class changes (avoid unnecessary reflows)
- Add loading state to prevent simultaneous update conflicts
- Auto-trigger visualization update after preset selection

These optimizations significantly reduce resource usage on mobile devices
when using quick visibility presets.

This makes the interface intuitive for users without context while maintaining all functionality.

commits.subject: Add notification permission button to home screen header Allow users to request notification permissions directly from the home screen via a bell icon button. The button shows a filled bell (🔔) when permissions are granted and a muted bell (🔕) otherwise. Tapping the button requests permissions, enabling users to easily manage notification settings without navigating to the banner in the chat list. Available on all platforms (native mobile, web mobile, and web desktop).
commits.title: Add notification permission button to home screen header Allow users to request notification permissions directly from the home screen via a bell icon button. The button shows a filled bell (🔔) when permissions are granted and a muted bell (🔕) otherwise. Tapping the button requests permissions, enabling users to easily manage notification settings without navigating to the banner in the chat list. Available on all platforms (native mobile, web mobile, and web desktop).

commits.subject: Add comprehensive notification support for web platforms
commits.body:
Implement full notification functionality for web mobile and web desktop:

**Sound & Vibration:**
- Add default notification sound for both web platforms
- Add vibration pattern [200ms, 100ms, 200ms] for web mobile
- Update service worker to include sound and vibration

**Badge Count:**
- Implement Badge API for app icon unread count
- Auto-update badge based on total unread messages across all chats
- Clear badge when user opens chat and marks messages as read
- Add setBadgeCount() and clearBadge() helper functions

**In-App Notifications:**
- Create InAppNotification component with slide-in animation
- Add InAppNotificationContext for global state management
- Show notifications when messages arrive in foreground
- Auto-dismiss after 4 seconds with tap-to-open functionality

**Infrastructure:**
- Update useMessages hook to trigger foreground/background notifications
- Update useChats hook to manage badge count
- Integrate InAppNotificationProvider in root layout
- Update documentation with all notification features

Files changed:
- services/notifications.ts: Add sound, vibration, badge API
- public/sw.js: Update service worker notification options
- components/InAppNotification.tsx: New in-app banner component
- contexts/InAppNotificationContext.tsx: New notification context
- hooks/useMessages.ts: Add notification triggers
- hooks/useChats.ts: Add badge count management
- app/_layout.tsx: Add InAppNotificationProvider
- CLAUDE.md: Document notification features
commits.title: Add comprehensive notification support for web platforms

commits.subject: Fixed message ordering issue in chat When sending a message, the optimistic update now maintains proper chronological order by sorting messages in descending order (newest first). Previously, sent messages would appear above older messages until the realtime subscription corrected the order, causing a visual jump. Now messages appear in the correct position immediately. Changes:
commits.body:
Add sorting to optimistic message update in useMessages hook
Ensures consistency with realtime subscription sorting behavior
commits.title: Fixed message ordering issue in chat When sending a message, the optimistic update now maintains proper chronological order by sorting messages in descending order (newest first). Previously, sent messages would appear above older messages until the realtime subscription corrected the order, causing a visual jump. Now messages appear in the correct position immediately. Changes:

commits.subject: Add platform-specific notification handling for web PC, web mobile, and native
commits.body:
Implement granular platform detection and notification support to properly handle notifications across three distinct platforms:
- Native mobile (iOS/Android): expo-notifications with APNs/FCM
- Web mobile: Service Worker with Web Push API
- Web desktop: Browser Notification API (banner hidden by default)

Add new platform detection utility (utils/platform.ts) that uses user agent, touch capability, and screen size to distinguish web mobile from web desktop.

Update notification service with platform-specific implementations:
- getNotificationCapabilities() returns platform-specific feature support
- Platform-aware permission requests and token retrieval
- Auto-register service worker for web mobile before requesting permissions

Enhance notification components with platform awareness:
- NotificationBanner shows platform-specific messaging and hides on web desktop
- useNotifications hook returns capabilities for UI adjustments
- Service worker improvements with skipWaiting() and clients.claim()
commits.title: Add platform-specific notification handling for web PC, web mobile, and native

commits.subject: Fix mobile web scrolling by removing tap gesture Remove tap gesture from mobile web message bubbles to prevent conflicts with vertical scrolling. Mobile web now only supports long-press (500ms) to open action sheet, while desktop web retains click, right-click, and hold-to-press interactions. Horizontal swipe-to-reply still works on both platforms.
commits.title: Fix mobile web scrolling by removing tap gesture Remove tap gesture from mobile web message bubbles to prevent conflicts with vertical scrolling. Mobile web now only supports long-press (500ms) to open action sheet, while desktop web retains click, right-click, and hold-to-press interactions. Horizontal swipe-to-reply still works on both platforms.

commits.subject: Update mobile web gesture handling to use tap-to-react Changed mobile web message bubble interaction to open reaction picker directly on tap, while long-press still opens full action sheet. This improves reliability on mobile web where tap gestures were conflicting with scrolling.
commits.body:
Add onQuickReact prop to MessageBubble for mobile web tap-to-react
Modify MessageBubbleWeb to prioritize quick react over action sheet on tap
Add ReactionPicker modal to chat screen for quick emoji selection
Desktop web behavior unchanged (click/right-click opens action sheet)
commits.title: Update mobile web gesture handling to use tap-to-react Changed mobile web message bubble interaction to open reaction picker directly on tap, while long-press still opens full action sheet. This improves reliability on mobile web where tap gestures were conflicting with scrolling.

commits.subject: cluade.md update
commits.title: cluade.md update

commits.subject: Fix mobile web gesture handling with platform-specific implementation
commits.body:
Completely rethought mobile web interactions by separating web and native implementations:

**Web Implementation (MessageBubbleWeb):**
- Use native browser event listeners (addEventListener) instead of RN props
- Support both touch events (mobile) and mouse events (desktop)
- Touch: tap, long-press, horizontal swipe-to-reply, vertical scroll
- Mouse: click, right-click, hold-to-press
- Vertical scrolling no longer interferes with message interactions

**Native Implementation (MessageBubbleNative):**
- Keep existing react-native-gesture-handler behavior
- Swipe-to-reply with visual feedback
- Tap or long-press for action sheet

**Pagination Fix:**
- Add maintainVisibleContentPosition prop to FlatList
- Prevents auto-scroll when loading older messages
- Preserves user's scroll position during pagination

Key insight: Stop fighting the browser - use native DOM events on web
instead of trying to make gesture-handler work like native scrolling.
commits.title: Fix mobile web gesture handling with platform-specific implementation

commits.subject: Fix auto-scroll when loading older messages via pagination
commits.body:
Modified polling logic in useMessages hook to update only affected messages instead of replacing entire message array. This prevents unwanted scroll-to-bottom behavior when users load older messages through infinite scroll.

Changes:
- Soft deletions: Filter out specific message IDs without recreating array
- New messages: Append and sort while preserving paginated messages
- Message updates: Map through existing array, updating only changed messages

This maintains scroll position stability during pagination while keeping realtime updates working correctly.
commits.title: Fix auto-scroll when loading older messages via pagination

commits.subject: Fix mobile web scrolling by optimizing gesture handling
commits.body:
- Increase horizontal swipe threshold on web (30px vs 10px) to prioritize vertical scrolling
- Reduce vertical fail threshold on web (10px vs 15px) so pan gesture fails quickly when scrolling
- Use Gesture.Simultaneous on web to allow both tap and swipe-to-reply without blocking scroll
- Re-enable swipe-to-reply on mobile web with gesture configuration that doesn't interfere with scrolling

The key fix is the lower failOffsetY threshold on web, which makes the pan gesture immediately yield to native scrolling when detecting vertical movement, while still allowing intentional horizontal swipes for the reply feature.
commits.title: Fix mobile web scrolling by optimizing gesture handling

commits.subject: Fix mobile web scrolling and pagination auto-scroll behavior
commits.body:
Resolved issue where loading older messages via pagination would trigger
unwanted auto-scroll to bottom, creating an infinite scroll loop on mobile web.

Changes:
- Add isLoadingMoreRef to track pagination state in chat screen
- Update onContentSizeChange to distinguish between new messages and pagination
- Modify polling mechanism to preserve paginated messages when updating recent messages
- Only auto-scroll when genuinely new messages arrive, not during history loading

This ensures smooth infinite scroll behavior while maintaining auto-scroll for new messages.
commits.title: Fix mobile web scrolling and pagination auto-scroll behavior

commits.subject: Fix mobile web scrolling and auto-scroll behavior in chat view
commits.body:
- Fix auto-scroll when loading older messages: Track message count to only auto-scroll when new messages arrive, not when paginating to older messages
- Improve mobile web scrolling: Remove pan and tap gestures on web to prevent conflicts with native scrolling and accidental action triggers
- Use long-press only on mobile web to open message action sheet, avoiding unintended actions from quick taps
- Native platforms retain tap, long-press, and swipe-to-reply gestures
commits.title: Fix mobile web scrolling and auto-scroll behavior in chat view

commits.subject: Fix message ordering and scroll behavior in chat view
commits.body:
- Remove `.reverse()` in getMessagesPaginated to maintain descending order (newest first)
- Update realtime message handler to sort in descending order for inverted FlatList
- Fix loadMoreMessages to correctly append older messages to end of descending array
- Replace scrollToEnd() with scrollToIndex(0) for proper inverted FlatList scrolling
- Ensure chat opens scrolled to bottom showing complete newest messages with reactions

Fixes issue where new messages appeared above older messages and initial
scroll position didn't show the full last message.
commits.title: Fix message ordering and scroll behavior in chat view

commits.subject: Add per-participant display names for chats
commits.body:
Allow each participant to set their own personal display name for a chat.
Display names are now stored per-participant (participant_1_display_name
and participant_2_display_name) rather than shared, giving users freedom
to name chats based on their own context.

Database changes:
- Remove single display_name column from chats table
- Add participant_1_display_name and participant_2_display_name columns
- Add 50-character length constraints for both columns

Backend changes:
- Update Chat, ChatInsert, and ChatUpdate TypeScript interfaces
- Update createChat() to set participant_1_display_name
- Update joinChat() to set participant_2_display_name
- Add getMyDisplayName() helper in useChats hook

UI changes:
- Update chat creation flow with optional name input screen
- Update join chat flow with optional name input field
- Update ChatListItem to display user's personal display name
- Update chat header to show user's personal display name
- Add myDisplayName property to ChatWithPreview interface

Also fixes chat screen scroll behavior:
- Consolidate multiple scroll-to-bottom calls into single scroll
- Add inverted prop to FlatList for proper chat UX
- Fix pagination to load older messages when scrolling up
commits.title: Add per-participant display names for chats

commits.subject: Fix mobile web scrolling and message visibility issues
commits.body:
- Increase pan gesture thresholds on web (30px) to prevent scroll conflicts
- Separate swipe-to-reply from tap/long-press gestures using Race composition
- Add auto-focus to input field when replying via swipe or action sheet
- Change "Copy Text" button styling to match secondary actions
- Increase FlatList bottom padding (pb-20) for reaction visibility
- Add delayed scroll on initial load (300ms) to account for reaction rendering
- Add secondary scroll trigger when reactions load to ensure last message visibility

These changes improve the mobile web experience by preventing accidental
gesture triggers during scrolling and ensuring all message content including
reactions is fully visible on initial chat load.
commits.title: Fix mobile web scrolling and message visibility issues

commits.subject: Fix chat message visibility and optimize initial load
commits.body:
- Add bottom padding (pb-8) to chat FlatList to ensure last message and reactions are fully visible
- Reduce initial message pagination from 50 to 15 for faster load times
- Users can still load older messages via infinite scroll
commits.title: Fix chat message visibility and optimize initial load

commits.subject: Add immediate emoji reactions to message action sheet
commits.body:
- Extract REACTION_EMOJIS constant to shared constants/reactions.ts file
- Display emoji picker directly at top of MessageActionSheet for faster access
- Remove separate ReactionPicker modal from chat flow (still available for backward compatibility)
- Update both MessageActionSheet and ReactionPicker to use shared emoji constant
- Remove background color from reaction buttons for cleaner appearance
- Reduce reaction flow from 4 taps to 2 taps

Users can now react to messages immediately when opening the action sheet instead of navigating through an additional modal.
commits.title: Add immediate emoji reactions to message action sheet

commits.subject: Fix message action sheet not appearing on web mobile
commits.body:
On web mobile, tapping a message was immediately executing an action
instead of showing the action sheet with options.

- Remove tap gesture on web platform (keep long-press and swipe only)
- Reduce long-press duration on web from 500ms to 300ms for better UX
- Keep native behavior unchanged (tap, long-press, and swipe all work)

This prevents accidental triggers on web while maintaining responsive
interaction through long-press (300ms) or swipe gestures.
commits.title: Fix message action sheet not appearing on web mobile

commits.subject: Make tone tagging optional and minimize category headings
commits.body:
- Update database constraint to allow 0-2 tones (previously required 1-2)
- Remove tone requirement from ComposeBar send validation
- Add "(optional)" label to tone selector instruction text
- Minimize category headings in ToneSelector compact variant:
  - Reduce font size from 12px to 9px
  - Lower opacity and use uppercase with letter-spacing
  - Reduce vertical margins for more screen space
- Keep "Most Used" section at top as primary recommendation
- Update sendMessage/tagReceiverTone to handle empty tone arrays
- Only track tone usage when tones are actually selected
commits.title: Make tone tagging optional and minimize category headings

commits.subject: Fix gesture handling and TypeScript error for message interactions
commits.body:
Improve gesture reliability on mobile by using onFinalize with success checks and Gesture.Exclusive composition. Fix JSX.Element type error in MessageActionSheet.

Changes:
- Use onFinalize instead of onEnd for tap and long-press gestures
- Add shouldCancelWhenOutside(true) to prevent gestures from completing when finger moves away
- Increase tap maxDuration to 400ms and long-press minDuration to 500ms for more deliberate interactions
- Add activeOffsetX and failOffsetY to pan gesture to require intentional horizontal movement
- Change gesture composition from Gesture.Race to Gesture.Exclusive for cleaner gesture recognition
- Add statusBarTranslucent and onStartShouldSetResponder to MessageActionSheet modal
- Fix return type from JSX.Element to React.JSX.Element in MessageActionSheet

These changes prevent accidental action triggers and ensure gestures only complete when intended, improving the mobile UX.
commits.title: Fix gesture handling and TypeScript error for message interactions

commits.subject: Add unified gesture handling for message interactions
commits.body:
Implement swipe gestures (left/right), tap, and long-press to all open the message action sheet, providing a consistent and intuitive UX across all interaction methods.

Changes:
- Add react-native-gesture-handler dependency for gesture support
- Replace Pressable with GestureDetector in MessageBubble component
- Implement pan gesture with 50px threshold for swipe detection
- Add visual feedback with animated horizontal translation during swipes
- Combine tap, long-press, and swipe gestures using Gesture.Race and Gesture.Simultaneous
- Wrap app with GestureHandlerRootView in root layout
- Remove redundant onLongPress prop from MessageBubble interface

All message interactions now trigger the same action sheet, improving discoverability and user experience.
commits.title: Add unified gesture handling for message interactions

commits.subject: Add comprehensive message actions with reply, delete, and moderation features
commits.body:
Implement full suite of message interaction capabilities including threaded replies, clipboard copy, soft/hard deletion, message info modal, and content reporting system.

**Reply to Messages:**
- Quote-style threading with visual reply references on message bubbles
- Reply preview bar in compose area shows original message excerpt
- Tap reply reference to scroll to original message with smooth animation
- Reply data stored denormalized on messages table (reply_to_id, reply_snippet, reply_sender_id) for optimal performance
- Replies to replies reference the original (1-level deep threading)

**Message Deletion:**
- Soft delete (Delete for Me): Removes from your view only via message_deletions table
- Hard delete (Delete for Everyone): Permanent deletion with 1-hour window, shows "[Message deleted]" tombstone
- Realtime sync ensures deletions propagate instantly to both participants

**Message Info & Moderation:**
- Message info modal displays delivery status, tones, reactions, and edit history
- Copy text to clipboard with toast confirmation
- Report inappropriate messages with category selection (spam, harassment, inappropriate, other)
- Anonymous reporting stored in message_reports table for future moderation

**UI/UX Improvements:**
- Unified MessageActionSheet component with context-aware actions
- Toast notifications provide feedback for copy, delete, and report actions
- Scroll-to-message with smooth animation when tapping reply references
- Platform-aware dialogs (window.confirm on web, Alert.alert on native)
- Automatic read marking only when tab/window is visible (prevents background marking)

**Database Schema:**
- New tables: message_replies (deprecated), message_deletions, message_reports
- Messages table additions: reply_to_id, reply_snippet, reply_sender_id, deleted_at, deleted_by
- Denormalized reply storage eliminates JOINs and ensures snippets work with realtime
- Full RLS policies for all new tables and updated message UPDATE permissions
- Realtime enabled for message_deletions table
- REPLICA IDENTITY FULL on messages table for reliable realtime UPDATE events

**Technical Details:**
- Reply snippets denormalized on messages table (first 100 chars) for performance
- message_replies table kept for backwards compatibility but deprecated
- 15-minute edit window and 5-edit limit enforced in application layer
- 1-hour hard delete window with sender verification
- Unique constraints prevent duplicate soft deletes and reports
- Platform-aware storage and dialogs for web/native compatibility
commits.title: Add comprehensive message actions with reply, delete, and moderation features

commits.subject: Add message editing for correcting spelling mistakes
commits.body:
Implemented comprehensive message editing functionality with constraints to prevent abuse:

Features:
- Edit messages within 15-minute window from sending
- Maximum 5 edits per message
- Tone tags are locked and cannot be changed
- "(edited)" indicator displayed on modified messages
- Cross-platform support (tap on web, tap/long-press on native)

UI/UX:
- Tap own messages to open action sheet with "Edit Message" and "Add Reaction" options
- Edit button only shown if message is within time/edit limits
- Reaction button always available on own messages
- Edit mode shows locked tones with "Tones (cannot be changed)" label
- Cancel button to exit edit mode
- Checkmark send icon when editing

Database:
- Added edited_at timestamp column to track last edit
- Added edit_count integer with max 5 constraint
- RLS policy allowing users to edit their own messages
- Optimistic updates with error rollback

Fixes:
- Fixed message bubble alignment for sent messages
- Fixed tone label overflow within bubble width
- Added polling fallback for reaction updates (3s interval)
- Fixed reaction removal not updating without refresh
- Improved realtime subscription logging for debugging
commits.title: Add message editing for correcting spelling mistakes

commits.subject: Add emoji reactions to messages
commits.body:
Implemented full emoji reaction support for messages in chat conversations. Users can react to any message (their own or received) with multiple different emojis, and toggle reactions on/off.

Features:
- Tap any message to open emoji picker with 12 popular reactions
- Multiple different reactions allowed per message
- Toggle reactions on/off by tapping reaction badges
- Real-time reaction updates across devices
- Optimistic UI updates for instant feedback
- Reaction counts displayed with visual feedback for user's reactions

Database changes:
- New reactions table with CASCADE deletion
- RLS policies for anonymous auth (view/add/remove own reactions)
- Realtime subscriptions enabled

Implementation:
- New ReactionPicker modal component (bottom sheet UI)
- New ReactionBar component (displays reaction badges below messages)
- New useReactions hook (state management with realtime sync)
- New reactions service (CRUD operations)
- Updated MessageBubble to support tap interaction and reaction display
- Updated chat screen to integrate reaction functionality

Technical details:
- Optimistic updates prevent UI lag
- Duplicate detection avoids double-counting from realtime events
- Grouped reactions by emoji with participant tracking
- Unique constraint prevents duplicate user+emoji combinations
commits.title: Add emoji reactions to messages

commits.subject: Remove manual tone reveal, automatically show tones on chat entry
commits.body:
Simplified UX by removing the tap-to-reveal interaction for message tones. Now messages are automatically marked as read and tones are revealed when entering a chat screen.

Changes:
- Auto-mark messages as read on chat entry (300ms delay after load)
- Remove "Reveal All" button and tap-to-reveal hints
- Always display sender tones on all messages
- Free up message tap gesture for future features (replies/reactions)
- Update documentation to reflect automatic reveal behavior

Technical:
- Renamed revealAll to markAllAsRead in useMessages hook
- Removed tagTone function (manual single message acknowledgment)
- Removed unreadCount from useMessages return type
- Simplified MessageBubble to always show tones
- Messages still use receiver_tone=[] and read_at for tracking
commits.title: Remove manual tone reveal, automatically show tones on chat entry

commits.subject: Created a reusable BackButton component to standardize navigation UI across create, join, and chat screens. The component provides a consistent circular button with left arrow icon, improving UX through unified visual language.
commits.title: Created a reusable BackButton component to standardize navigation UI across create, join, and chat screens. The component provides a consistent circular button with left arrow icon, improving UX through unified visual language.

commits.subject: Refactor: Eliminate code duplication and improve maintainability
commits.body:
- Create reusable utility functions for common operations:
  - utils/avatarColors.ts: Centralized avatar color generation
  - utils/formatting.ts: Centralized timestamp formatting
  - utils/dialogs.ts: Platform-agnostic confirmation dialogs
  - utils/clearData.ts: Unified data clearing logic
  - utils/logger.ts: Standardized logging with prefixes
  - utils/subscriptions.ts: Reusable Supabase subscription abstraction

- Create hooks/usePolling.ts for reusable polling pattern

- Update components to use shared utilities:
  - ChatListItem.tsx: Use shared avatar colors, formatting, and dialogs
  - MessageBubble.tsx: Use shared timestamp formatting
  - chat/[id].tsx: Use shared avatar colors
  - home.tsx: Use clearData utility, fix useEffect dependencies
  - _layout.tsx: Use clearData utility
  - create.tsx: Use usePolling hook

- Fix bugs:
  - home.tsx: Add missing useEffect dependencies (refetch, instanceId)
  - appStore.ts: Remove duplicate state initialization

reactions feature, while simplifying the core UX to focus on sender intent
rather than perception comparison.

commits.subject: Add session management and fix realtime subscription issues
commits.body:
## Session Management
- Add `clearAllStorage()` function to clear all local data across platforms
  - Web: Clears AsyncStorage, localStorage, and sessionStorage
  - Native: Clears AsyncStorage and SecureStore
- Add logout/clear data button (🗑️) in home screen header
- Add "Clear Data & Retry" button on initialization error screen
- Both buttons sign out from Supabase and reload app after clearing data

## Realtime Subscription Fixes
- Add polling fallback (2s interval) for chat join detection
  - Ensures creator navigates to chat when participant joins
  - Works even if Supabase realtime subscription fails
- Add polling fallback (3s interval) for message tone updates
  - Ensures sender sees receiver's tone tags
  - Detects receiver_tone changes reliably
- Add comprehensive debug logging throughout subscription flow
  - Chat subscriptions: creation, status, updates
  - Message subscriptions: new messages, updates, tone tagging
  - Join flow: validation, database updates, navigation

## UX Improvements
- Add X button to create chat screen header for easy navigation back
- Remove redundant cancel button from create screen footer
- Improve error handling with detailed console logs

All changes maintain backward compatibility and use polling as a
reliable fallback while keeping realtime as the primary mechanism for
better performance when it works.
commits.title: Add session management and fix realtime subscription issues

commits.subject: Deploy via Vercel Dashboard
commits.body:
Go to vercel.com
Click "Add New Project"
Import your GitHub repository
Vercel will auto-detect the settings
3. Configure Vercel (Create vercel.json)
For better control, I recommend creating a vercel.json configuration file:
Write vercel.json
14 lines
4. Set Environment Variables
You'll need to add your Supabase credentials to Vercel:
In Vercel Dashboard → Your Project → Settings → Environment Variables
Add these variables:
EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL = your Supabase URL
EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY = your Supabase anon key
5. Add build script to package.json
Let me update your package.json to include export commands:
Edit package.json
Added 1 line
Perfect! Now you can also use npm run build:web for building.
Quick Deployment Commands
# Build and test locally first
npm run build:web
npx serve dist

# Then deploy to Vercel
vercel

# Or for production deployment
vercel --prod
Important Notes
Environment Variables: Make sure to set your Supabase environment variables in Vercel's dashboard before deploying
Git Push Auto-Deploy: Once connected, every push to your main branch will automatically trigger a new deployment on Vercel
Preview Deployments: Pull requests get their own preview URLs automatically
Custom Domain: You can add a custom domain in Vercel's project settings
Local Testing: Before deploying, test the build locally:
npm run build:web
npx serve dist
The configuration I created will:
Build your Expo web app on each deployment
Serve files from the dist directory
Handle client-side routing properly (all routes redirect to index.html)
Remove trailing slashes for cleaner URLs
Your app should now be ready to deploy to Vercel! 🚀
commits.title: Deploy via Vercel Dashboard
